reviews.text: I really dislike leaving any business a poor review, especially one that I have supported for so many years. Today my husband and I went to Sunday Brunch for my birthday. We went into the bar hoping to catch some football but their 2 TVs were &#34;broken&#34;. I ordered a mimosa and it came in a glass that was not only small but had a lot more orange juice than champagne. When I asked our server if it came in a 1/2 caraf or anything larger, the bartender told her she could put it in a wine glass and charge me twice the price, which would be $17.00. I opted out. I ordered the CA omelette and when I got it, the potatoes were cold. We had to ask for absolutely everything during our meal. More coffee, salt and pepper, another drink, and the check etc. we even had to ask for our plates to be removed. Our son is a server so we&#39;re super sensitive about tipping well, but we only left 10% today which pulls on my heartstrings. I don&#39;t blame the server, I blame management for not training her properly and not keeping a finger on the pulse of what&#39;s happening in the restaurant. Sad to say we most likely won&#39;t be returning anytime soon. There&#39;s just too many other better options.

My husband called an order to go and said he would get a slice of cheesecake when he got there to add to the order.  He arrived and our meal order was ready, hubby said he would like to add a piece of cheesecake to the order.  Guy at bakery counter told him &#34;you should have called that in too&#34;.  Told him it would take 5-8 minutes to get the slice of cheesecake and there were two other people working there.  Second time in a month we&#39;ve had crappy service at Cheesecake Factory.  If I had been there I would have called the manager over immediately.  Don&#39;t waste your time, this restaurant has obviously lost their customer service focus.

Horrible horrible service! I ordered through Door Dash and the chicken picatta came as dried chicken breast with nothing else. The manager at the restaurant said she couldn&#39;t help me at all since I ordered through Door Dash (she seemed completely apathetic and unwilling g to help at all). It took me several attempts and long conversations through Door Dash who wouldn&#39;t refund me for the meal, tip, &amp; service fee. It&#39;s insane! Horrible service.

We ordered a pumpkin cheesecake for Thanksgiving dinner. Server asked us if we wanted pecan or regular. We told her definitely regular didn&#39;t want the pecan. Today we took it out, thawed it only to discover it was pecan. SO disappointed. Sadly this has happened before with another that we throughly enjoyed but I figured since she asked and we were insistent that it could not be pecan we were safe. Next time I&#39;ll probably go to Costco. Dang I so wanted pumpkin.

Went to Cheesecake Factory today and was very disappointed, the salad I ordered, the guacamole salad had very little cheese and equally little beans and corn,  I Lol as they seemed like a garnish. Also I got my initial drink brought to me AFTER my lunch came!  This is not a Covid induced complaint either. They were not very busy today.  Too bad. Food is normally good and so is the service.     Update: I am not sure why Cheese Cake Factory routed me to General Questions?  This is not a question, rather a review that is not positive, why re-route me?  Why not address this here?  Even more disappointed to be handed off to &#34;General Question&#39;s&#34; what is that supposed to achieve?  That customer service is handled through a questions department?

Huge thank you to this whole team! We ordered through Doordash right before their system went down, so we never got our order. So I called and asked if I could just order the whole thing again and pay them when I picked it up (everything has been sitting for so long that it was not good anymore). But the manager offered to do it for free since I had already paid for it through Doordash.<br><br>This was such great news after the longest day ever. Thank you again!

Say they take reservations over the phone. Transferred to desk and was told they don&#39;t. I have to use the website. Tried using the website. Won&#39;t do a reservation for more the 6 and you have to call to make one.  Then called and found out they don&#39;t take reservations over 6 on the weekend. Sigh. Wish they would get the story straight. And this has nothing to do with Covid.

Not to shabby. The steaks we had were good, drinks were delicious, but they pack ya in like sardines! <br>The lighting is so low we could hardly see our food. Didn&#39;t matter my because it tasted good. <br>Dessert is always delicious, when you want to share a slice!  Crispy Brussels sprouts were amazing as well!

Terrible drive up service. Placed an order on-line, paid and headed to the restaurant. Arrived 25 minutes later and announced I was there for pickup. I was told it was not ready and I will receive a text message when ready. At 45 minutes from the original order, I went inside to check on the order. It was still not ready. At an hour, I requested my money back. Be prepared for a long wait and still no text message at the hour....

Another great waiter for my friend&#39;s birthday dinner celebration. :-) he was very personable and easy to interact with. He said his favorite part of the job is the employees he works with so I can see there is great hiring going on.<br>But I got there too late and my friends had already eaten but free bread was still there, and was delish as always, and was worth a tip for his great customer service.

Always, Cheesecake Factory provides delicious food for dine-in or takeout. We have never been disappointed for new or classic choices on their menu. This time, we ordered takeout, and everything was new for us this time, not surprisingly excellent! All was ready when I arrived in 20 minutes, still hot when we dined at home, and worth the time &amp; money! PLUS you can&#39;t miss or skip the world famous CHEESECAKE. They have a couple dozen varieties to choose from! A few favorites include White Chocolate Macadamia Caramel Cheesecake, Mango Key Lime Cheesecake, (classic) Strawberry Cheesecake, Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake...<br>A good writer can make a review worthy of the quality of the overall culinary experience at Cheesecake Factory, but please go check it out yourself with someone for a birthday, an anniversary, or whatever!

While up in the area of the mall we were trying to figure out where to go to eat and remembered we had not been to cheesecake factory in a long time. Most of the restaurant is still the same if you&#39;ve been going off and on for over a decade like we have, and just like all the yelp reviews, always a long dreaded wait which usually takes much longer than they even say. We got our buzzer at 7 PM were told 30 minute wait.... after 45 minutes we were seated. We decided to split a meal, the wife and I, because we wanted to have room for cheesecake of course. We ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken that comes on a spaghetti type noodle, and instead of the red sauce we substituted it for their Alfredo sauce which is quite delicious as we&#39;ve have  had it in the past. Plenty of food for two people if you have salads and such. We each ordered a salad prior to the meal, One house salad and one Caesar salad. The small salads aren&#39;t much to speak of, the house salad is just lettuce us throw on a plate with really no other garnishes to go with it and your side of dressing. The Caesar salad was pretty flavorless and is so finally chopped it&#39;s hard to eat but it is plenty big. The house bread thats served with any meal is absolutely amazing though. After our salads we waited a half hour for the meal to show up, way too long after we&#39;ve already eaten two loaves of bread waiting, we let the waiter know that it was lukewarm as well, the manager and the waiter were extremely nice and we were comped the meal. That gave us even more of an excuse to splurge on the cheesecake, in which we got a large to die for caramel pecan turtle helping. Incredible, barely finished it. This review comes with a mixed heart, the food is very good but the wait was ridicules especially since you can&#39;t call ahead for seating, and the fact that we were comped the main meal helped and just the fact that they knew it could&#39;ve been better as well. I&#39;m rating this three stars because we will be back of course, and when it&#39;s better I will adjust my rating. My biggest tip would be to come when you have extra time so you can get a buzzer and go maybe walk around the mall and shop till about 10 minutes before they say so you&#39;re sure to be there when it does buzz. Just way too long of a wait to just stand and be in a heard like cattle. Another problem I have is the center seating are almost family style tables you&#39;re literally closer to someone you don&#39;t know on your left or right than you are with your date directly across in front of you. It is quite loud and you have to raise your voice to hear Each other, fortunately we had a end table up against one of the center walls so we weren&#39;t as crowded.  Sorry for the dark photos, the Restraunt has such poor lighting that we had a hard time reading our menu as well.
Disappointed in the customer service response when I called in to change my appointment time. The staff is usually friendly and helpful so I&#39;m very surprised by this negative experience.

Had delivery from doordash and there was 6 chicken pieces in my chicken w/ broccoli pasta dish. My friend has the chicken coconut thai dish and he really liked his but this is my review. If I&#39;m paying $15+ for a pasta dish i expect to eat food.

We ALL know how amazing this place is. When we go, we all choose to ignore the ENORMOUS amounts of fat, calories, grease, etc that is in whatever we order...except for maybe caesar salad...WITHOUT dressing hahaha! <br>So, I went here for my Birthday a couple weeks ago. Our original plan was to go to Romio&#39;s, but my Birthday landed on a Sunday this year...I know, yawwwwn! Next year...MONDAY! ugh lol.<br>Romio&#39;s was closed and apparently is now closed every Sunday...but whatever! At least I&#39;m not bitter  lol.<br>So we went to Cheesecake Factory. In the past, I always loved their 4 cheese pasta. I mean, shit is delicious! OH! and one of the best things there....their pumpernickel bread! RIDICULOUSLY GREAT! hahaha! <br>Yeah, I carb TF...OUUUUT when I go there lol. We all deserve a night like that every once in awhile....even if the calories are tripled compared to other restaurants lol.<br>That brings me to this. The REASON  ahhh, the reason for the 3 stars.<br>In the past, you&#39;d go there, pay like 16-18 bucks for this 4 cheese pasta. The prices went UP and the servings....went...dowwwwwn! <br>Very disappointing. <br>As some of you know, I kinda love the gym. I&#39;m there/here a lot lol. <br>So when I have a &#34;fat night&#34; I want that....a fat night hahaha! I got good food, but I was do sad at the servings size. <br>Cheesecake has lost a lot of it&#39;s magic and appeal....for ME at least. It&#39;s obviously still a very popular restaurant. Maybe for me, because I don&#39;t eat a lot of that type of food anymore, that&#39;s why it&#39;s lost a lot of it&#39;s appeal...I dunno. Last time I was there...was like 2 years ago and I got almost double of what I got. <br>This usually happens to restaurants and tho. They suck you in, get you hooked, then they switch shit up ALL KINDS of crazy too and then....they don&#39;t think customers notice...OR maybe they do and just don&#39;t give a shit  haha! <br>I know many reading this, love that place and don&#39;t get me wrong, I just LIKE it now. My love for the Factory....has died. The candle has burned out hahaha! <br>Will I go there again? Ha! No. Probably not. Why would I do that when Romio&#39;s is literally 3 minutes north of there!! Hahaha! <br>When I&#39;m back home in NY, visiting family and if they wanna go there (my parents) of course I&#39;d take them. My dad loves that place.<br>My mom, whenever we went in the past, she&#39;d say in her thick NY accent...&#34;ya know this crap is LOADED with calories! It&#39;s &#39;haarrible&#39; for ya&#39;s&#34; I&#39;m like...and yet, here ya are eating with us! &#34;I&#39;m here for the Cheesecake and cawfee&#34; <br>Anyway, that&#39;s probably the only way I&#39;d go again or if a friend wanted to go or something...because...AGAIN...Romio&#39;s is right up the street.<br>I wish for the life of me that I could remember our waitresses name was. She was FANTASTIC! So friendly and gentle. I loved her. Cheesecake always has amazing staff. Super friendly. This woman was extra special though.<br>Ok, ya&#39;ll! That&#39;s it for me on Cheesecake Factory! <br><br>If you read all of it....THANKS! I appreciate you! <br><br>Cheers, everyone!

I used to enjoy this restaurant but there are way to many exceptional places for the same price as eating here. I likely won&#39;t be back after my last experience. My daughter got take out and $18 later we had two pieces of cheesecake. One had rotten strawberries on it, which we couldn&#39;t tell until we got home. For a $9 piece of cheesecake it should be fresh and delicious.
Excellent food, fantastic service. The food took a little long to come,however the wait was so worth it. PS the Coconut Mojito is delicious.

I really enjoy the food here and wish we could come inside and eat but every time we try we can never even hear each other talk. This place is to loud and impossible to enjoy if dining in. We only door dash or do carry out.

We dined at the Boise location 2 nights ago. I was nervous to dine there because I know that the menu is HUGE.. so many options. So I told myself to only order something off the Skinnylicious menu.. and something I would not prepare at home. So I ordered the skinnylicious salmon. UMMM YUM!!<br>It had a nice crisp sear to it, mild and flavorful! The broccoli and carrots were fresh and tasty! Thumbs up!

Went to The Cheesecake Factory with a few of my friends and we&#39;re seated immediately. First glance at the menu and it was practically a novel. About 20 pages of I remember correctly. The alcoholic beverages (peach Bellini and vodka tonic) were apparently delicious (I&#39;m not 21 but my friends were). However, the food was kind of plain. I ordered the fish and chips and the fish was flavorless and dry and the outside was a little overcooked but the fries were good. Unique sauces as well. The bread that they serve before the meal was to die for! My boyfriend got the Chicken Alfredo and it was soooo buttery, which I&#39;m not a big fan of cause I feel like a dish should have more taste than just butter. Now the cheesecake... that was the best cheesecake I have ever had and is the main reason why this review is four stars. I got the mango key lime cheesecake and it was just rich enough. The service was amazing! I can&#39;t quite remember the server&#39;s name but she did a great job and was very funny. Good lunch portions. Overall, a good meal just less flavor than expected in accordance with the prices.
The food is amazing and the service perfect. I also highly recommend the mango key lime cheesecake, I think it&#39;s the best I&#39;ve ever had!!

We stopped over here for a quick bite on our overnight passing through Boise. We were happy to find a restaurant we know where the food is good with nice large portions. We arrived at 5, which was great because we were able to get seated right away. I liked how they had an abbreviated menu with slightly smaller portions. We didn&#39;t want to have any leftovers, and this was just right. I got the shrimp dish with the sauce on the side. That was perfect because the shrimp was plenty buttery and with the sauce too it would have been way to much cream. My husband got the fish tacos. That was a very nice portion size and he ate it all and was full and satisfied at the end. My kids each ordered the kids meal sliders. It was nice they also got a drink and dessert. The Cheesecake Factory is always good. We left happy and full.

I normally would give this place a 5 star review for getting us seated quickly and pretty friendly and quick service, but we were so disappointed with our food. I asked for something to be put on the side and it still had some inside my meal. My husband got a flatbread and it wasn&#39;t even cooked all the way so when he picked up a slice it was floppy and all his toppings kept falling off. For wanting a nice night out it was kind of disappointing.

This is not the first cheesecake factory I have been too, but this is probably the last time I will be going to this location. My husband and I went here yesterday for the first time to have a early dinner. We arrived and waited 15mins to be seated, when we were seated we noticed that we could see about 14 open tables around us, I only assume there wasn&#39;t  enough staff so I didn&#39;t think to much of it.<br><br>Our waitress came and got us drinks and brought us bread, while we sat there my husband pointed out that the table had a bunch of caked on gunk on it. Now I know that no restaurant table is super clean, but I would like to think that they could get the chunky stuff off at least.  After he pointed that out he pointed me to the floor of the table next to us. Now this table along with 5-6 more next to them were all bussed and set up to seat people, no one was using them. But the floor underneath the one next to us had flood under it, and not just bread crumbs, but some decent sized pieces. We looked  around us and there was a lot of old food pieces, some dirty napkins, and just filth. I get that floors get dirty but the place wasn&#39;t that busy and if you have all these open tables you would think someone could grab a broom and just do a quick clean up to get the big stuff.<br><br>As for the food. I had the club sandwich which was good, but it is hard to mess up a club. My husband had some sort of spicy chicken sandwich which wasn&#39;t spicy, had almost no chipotle sauce, and the cheese looked like it just sat out in a warm place instead of being melted on top. We both had fries as a side which were insanely bland.<br><br>The services was ok. The waitress and hosts were nice and friendly, but our waitress wasn&#39;t super attentive and didn&#39;t get drink refills till we were done eatting, which was kind of a waste. In the end we left disappointed and slightly grossed out.

Believe it or not, this is actually a great place to get an amazing meal while dieting! I&#39;ve done it 3 times! It doesn&#39;t hurt that I&#39;m not a big cheesecake fan. They have an entire menu of delicious skinny options! I had the Tuscan chicken and it was outstanding! Just under 600 calories, but I only ate 2/3 so even less. While everyone else is loading up and feeling stuffed and guilty, you can stick to your diet and feel fantastic!

Cheesecake Factory has been my go to for Sunday brunch for a long time- today there were four of us, we arrived as the first group of six tables this morning. Every table around us was served and near finished before a Manager came to our table to apologize that the waffle maker was broken and food would be out soon- our waitress never came back until it was time to collect the check. Only two of us ordered waffles, the rest of the food arrived cold after a hour and 15 mins. Our waffles were the wrong ones and when we asked for the accompaniments the Manager seemed irritated. Our bill wasn&#39;t even partially comped? $100 for brunch for 4- I expect better. Will not return.

I love the food at cheesecake but it is so disappointing when I order delivery and never get bread and butter. The bread and butter is one of our favorite parts and it should be included in all the orders.

The food was great as always. I got the lettuce wraps and she helped me make them vegan friendly. My daughter loves getting sides so she ordered green beans and mashed potatoes. Our server, Seau was the best part of our visit. She is very kind, funny and personable. We will be back because of her!! Thanks Seau, you&#39;re awesome!

Reviewer #120<br><br>I&#39;m a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory, specifically the cheesecake! <br>They have lots of very good food, too, but the cheesecake come in so many flavors, and large sizes that I find myself going out to dinner elsewhere and stopping by here for dessert. <br><br>My mom got a side of strawberries for her cheesecake and gave them to me. To be completely honest, they were the biggest, best tasting strawberries ever. I felt like I never had a real strawberry until I had one from CF. I think they fly them in super fresh or something. <br><br>There is sure to be a flavor that everyone will love. <br><br>The seating isn&#39;t the best and you&#39;re super close to other people, but it is what it is. The artwork on and architecture is beautiful and a conversation piece for sure.

I have always loved the cheesecake that I can get at Cheesecake Factory, but I have really started to enjoy their actual food as well! Yes, the menu is extensive.  I wish it was like a 1/3 of the size it is, but I end up sticking with what I know &amp; don&#39;t venture out to try something new. <br>My husband and I had Hunter as our server for the last 2 visits. I have to admit that service in the past has been pretty hit or miss....with more misses than hits. However, once we had Hunter, my faith was restored! He is always totally attentive without being annoying, he is super friendly, and he even managed to remember exactly how I wanted my cheesecake. I hadn&#39;t been here for about a month and my cheesecake order is a bit of a pain in the ass...strawberries on the side, glaze on the side, whipped cream on the side, &amp; I want the original cheesecake with the sour cream topping, not the standard cheesecake that is served with the strawberry cheesecake. Yes, I have food issues. Yes, I know I am a pain...but I do tip well!  He has only been our server once before tonight, but remembered everything about my order. Impressive. <br>For dinner tonight we ordered:<br>Chicken Parmesan Pizza Style<br>Old Fashioned Cheeseburger &amp; fries<br><br>The Chicken parm is seriously AH-MAZING!! Seriously! It&#39;s balanced perfectly and the chicken maintains its crispness without tasting over fried or breaded<br><br>The burger was also on point.  It&#39;s always seasoned really well and doesn&#39;t require a ton of sauce to make up for the lack of flavor. <br><br>The only negative is how crowded it gets and when it&#39;s crowded (most nights) you are seated super close to other diners. It doesn&#39;t allow for much privacy, but hey, I&#39;m willing to endure it when the reward at the end of the night is cheesecake!

One of my favorite restaurants. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here. They&#39;ve never messed up my meal. I love their bread I actually look forward to that. <br>Favorite dish is the Steak Diane. Mr. Euro (my fiancé) loves their chicken dishes. He&#39;s into their chicken piccata right now. Cheesecake wise, go for the white chocolate raspberry. It&#39;s so good, it&#39;s delicious but not too rich. You can actually enjoy it. Great food, wonderful ambiance. My only complaint if I had to find one is there&#39;s bad cell phone reception? Haha. But you don&#39;t need your phone at dinner anyway! Great place!

Cheesecake Factory usually is very good which is why I gave them 3 stars... but I just had the lettuce wraps delivered through Doordash and the lettuce was very dirty, and looked old. The rest of the order was very good, but ended up tossing the lettuce part of the lettuce wrap... that being said, I will be visiting this establishment again.

Getting seated took a while, as usual for Cheesecake Factory. Once we got seated the service was great! We got our food faster than I expected and the waiter always made sure we were taken care of. You can&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory!

I love the Cheesecake Factory, they have excellent food and the place is usually clean. I gave this location 2 stars because the service is terrible. I came in to eat on way through town and waited over an hour for my food. I decided to give them another try, stopping in on my way through, i decided to order to order to go and I had to wait 30 mins just to put my order in. They need more help on the to-go side.

The menu at this place is the biggest  I have ever seen in a restaurant.   I kid you not that it has several pages just for the appetizers.  That being said,  there is something for everyone in your group.  The place is very big and is nice plus they do have a bar.  We love the selection of small breads that come out before the meal.  The waiters are professional and effective. The kitchen gets your food out pretty quickly and does well if you have a modification to your meal.  We like to order a selection of appetizers and call it a meal but I have ordered from the menu and have always been pleased.  We also enjoy ordering our cheesecake to go at the end of the mill. The hardest part is picking out one of the cheesecakes from what I perceive that is at least 25 choices.  I would definitely recommend this place as one of the best restaurants in the mall area.

I will admit I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants and I tend to stay away from them. When The Cheesecake Factory was one of the few options I had for food delivery, I figured I would give it a try. I was actually pleasantly surprised with the food that was delivered! The egg roll sampler, chicken riesling, truffle honey chicken, and cheesecake were SO GOOD!! I&#39;m so glad I decided to step out of my &#34;chain restaurant&#34; comfort zone with this one :)

Huge portions and good reliable food. Service was great. Our Airbnb waitress was amazing, patient with us making our way through the huge menu and recommending good choices from it. Will come back again.

Our bartender, Katie provided the best bar and food service imaginable ... all with the brightest smile and  most attentive attitude. We watched her ensure that all her customers felt special, and her team mates were kept uplifted, as well. She seems very well trained  in customer service at the most professional level. We&#39;d steal her away for our business if we  could!

Great Service from Dannie .. Prompt, Friendly, and Very Professional.<br>Make Sure You Ask for Dannie&#39;s section. We had a Pricing / Coupon Error and Filinea , The Manager, (hope I spelled her name Right) is a Class Act as she Immediately Apologized for the Misunderstanding  and Took care of it<br>with a Smile .. Very Impressed.... Oh Yeah, The Shrimp Scampi was Just <br>Amazing .. and Lastly .. Don&#39;t order the Hot Fudge Sundae, it is about the<br>Size of a VW Bug.. Huge ... <br>kudos from Big Mama

This review is based both on quality of food and service. In the last month we have been here twice. Both times we didn&#39;t receive the usual attentiveness we&#39;ve come to expect for CF over the last 10 years(Experiences include SoCal NorCal Seattle and Bellevue).<br><br>Our cocktails didn&#39;t come until after our meal when they were ordered before, and I expected them to come with our appetizers. And we had to request more drinks, flagging other waiters down just to get help. The drinks never came. And both times my husband said his steak was over cooked and poor quality. <br><br>Needless to say, we decided to skip dessert not sure if we would get it at all.

Want delicious food? Go to The Cheesecake Factory! SO delicious! I tried the crispy fried cheese, mac &amp; cheese burger, and white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake. My husband had a pepperoni pizza. They also give you warm bread and butter.<br><br>Here&#39;s my thoughts on the food: the complimentary bread and butter was very yummy! I tried a couple bites and was hooked. I ate too much because I couldn&#39;t help it! The crispy fried cheese and marinara was PERFECT. Seriously amazing. Delicious blend of spices and the cheese was extremely melty, creamy, and hot. No room for improvement, they were just wonderful. The mac and cheese burger was also delicious. The burger itself had great flavor and was cooked well. It was very juicy, which is a must for a good burger. I loved the toasted buns, too. It comes with onions/lettuce/tomatoes etc on the side, but I didn&#39;t put anything on it. I wanted the full taste of the burger. I will say that the strong (but yummy) flavor of the burger basically overpowers the taste of the fried mac and cheese, so it&#39;s not very obvious that you&#39;re even eating mac and cheese too. The extra cheese sauce they drizzle on it is flavorful though, and just having the mac and cheese on it contributes to the juiciness of the whole thing. I&#39;m glad I ordered it because it was a very good burger! But next time if I ordered I wouldn&#39;t bother wasting the calories on the extra mac and cheese since it&#39;s not really that noticeable. It&#39;s more about how good their burger is on it&#39;s own! The fries that come with it are good, but not amazing. The white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake was absolutely delicious. I loved it so much. I was absolutely stuffed from the other food and still couldn&#39;t get enough. My husband said the pepperoni pizza was good. Not anything particularly special, though.<br><br>As far as the service, it was great. The restaurant was busy, but beautiful to look at (if quite darkly lit). A couple of negative things did happen, due to human error. The lady who brought our food to the table accidentally tipped my husband&#39;s platter so that one of his slices of pizza slipped onto her arm. She apologized and they made it up by bringing extra pizza to the table. At the end, our waiter accidentally brought the wrong receipt and we didn&#39;t read it carefully enough, paying an extra $10 for our meal. He stopped us on our way out to apologize and correct the mistake. These things were really no big deal, and the only reason I mention them at all is because I find that in reviews people often find any excuse to be angry with an establishment. We didn&#39;t let silly things ruin our night. We had a great time at The Cheesecake Factory. They brought our food quickly, our waiter was friendly and consistent with checking in, and we of course loved the food. I will definitely be returning to try more things on the menu, because they have something for EVERYONE. Huge menu with every option imaginable. If you&#39;ve never been, it&#39;s time to give it a try!

I want to give this place more stars because I have eaten at other locations in Ca and been really impressed, but I wasn&#39;t very pleased with my chicken enchiladas. They were okay, but something about the food seemed tired and old and dry. The black beans were the best part of the entree. However, I really enjoyed the fried Korean cauliflower appetizer. The texture, taste, and sauces are delightful. Would return again to try something else since their menu is so enormous.

I am beyond disappointed with the quality of the cheesecake I received from the Cheesecake Factory today. I ordered the cake for my daughter&#39;s 16th birthday, as cheesecake is her favorite. I sent my husband to retrieve the cake and when he brought it home, not only was the writing barely legible,  but her name was spelled incorrectly, the cake was already sliced (could have lived with that) and there is a large dent in the side. This cake was over $60. I will never order a birthday cake from there again.
The food is amazing!!! I sat at the bar and Katie C was soooooo sweet and friendly!!! She makes great drinks and gives great menu choices!!!!  I will be back!!!       Krissy!

I love Cheesecake Factory! I love the food and the desert! My husband and I come for brunch all the time which is always wonderful!  The lemon ricotta pancakes are so good!  The place is very clean. One thing I think that could be improved it&#39;s the silverware . When you get to the table the bare silverware is sitting on the bare table.  And that is a little bothersome for a germ a phob like me haha .  So it would be nice if they set the silverware on a napkin or wrapped it up .  I had tacos last time we came for dinner the fish tacos! They were very delightful  everything came out nice and hot!

Absolutely appalled by how slow this restaurant is. My wife and I went to Olive Garden for supper then she headed home and I stopped by CCF to pick up dessert and take it home. 2 slices of pie. I was told, &#34;give me a couple minutes and I will have that right out for you&#34;. TWENTY-FIVE minutes later she finally noticed I was still standing there. The problem is, this is not the first time I have had to wait forever for a to-go order here. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Great diversity of food. <br><br>Asian food wise:<br>Love the Shanghai spicy noodle  very favorable. <br>Cashew chicken with rice is great. It is not honeyed sweet version but more like a authentic Chinese style.

From out of town and had pulled in for a to go order. I ordered a Greek salad.. got to the hotel to unpack a salad that is made with yellowed, wilted lettuce. I ordered it with no onions, it came with onions and zero dressing. None. And none on the side. I had to throw it away. When in Boise I&#39;ll definitely eat somewhere else.

Typical Cheesecake Factory  Fantastic service, food came quick. (Bread took a while, but it&#39;s fresh, so no complaints ) Platters has way less food than all previous locations we&#39;ve been to. We typically like to save leftovers for a next day meal... first time we&#39;ve had that issue. Otherwise, good stuff

I&#39;ve always liked this place , the food is pretty great for a chain restaurant . I found out they serve brunch this weekend while we were there . The lemon ricotta pancakes were to die .The hazelnut chocolate cheesecake is insanely good , and Our server ( Jake ? ) was really  great .<br>The bad part is how it gets so hard to hear what the person In front of you is saying when. It&#39;s busy because the outdated music they play over the speakers is so loud it&#39;s deafening. Also it&#39;s claustrophobic when you&#39;re sat in the bar at those low top tables . Feels like like people are way too close for comfort. Other than that I would probably give it five stars .

We went for brunch and were seated quickly. The front desk person was friendly as was the waitstaff. I ordered the brioche French toast which sounded amazing and the looks of them did not disappoint. However the insides were just to squishy for me. Our waitress handled my request for something else amazingly well and a Belgian waffle was a perfect swap. Sunday morning brunch went off, with just a small hitch that was handled quickly and efficiently. Thank you waitress at Cheesecake Factory for not making me feel bad.

We&#39;ve been going to the cheesecake factory for probably 20 years now. We moved to Boise a couple years ago and had a good meal here. Since then the food has gone downhill dramatically but the price stays incredibly high. Recently we had an order delivered. Two fettuccine Alfredos neither of which came with garlic bread, and one was filled up about twice as much as the other. Another order included shrimp scampi, which included a few shrimp a tiny mound of angel hair pasta, and the sauce was in a little plastic container. The last was chicken marsala or other chicken dish that my daughter almost refused to eat. Five skimpy meals for $100, and most of the leftovers went in the trash. We will never return or order from cheesecake again. I will add that a month ago we did eat in the restaurant and I ordered a Carne Asada Which was probably the worst meal I&#39;ve ever had in the Boise area. I don&#39;t know if they&#39;ve change the cooks or management but this place has really gone down hill. You&#39;re better off going to a fast food restaurant.

I have been impressed lately with the menu options. I&#39;m glad they are going to a more healthier menu options. I have discovered their avocado toast. Oh my, it is delicious! I like to add chicken to mine. The amount of avocado they add, they don&#39;t skimp on the portions. I also love their mint iced green tea. The server we had was nice, checked on us several times and my drink was never empty.

Took my family here while my mother was in town. Had an amazing time...Shane took amazing care of us. He let me try the bloody mary mix before I ordered to make sure it was something I liked. We got warm bread and butter before our meal and ordered the fried mac and cheese and the crab artichoke dip for an appitizer. He offered to walk us through the exstensive menu which includes a wide variety of entrees. All of the entrees we ordered were amazing. Shane boxed up our food for us and our cheesecake. He also boxed up my salmon which I had today and i&#39;d have to say was still amazing. 5 stars to the the host, server, and kitchen. The Cheesecake Factory definatly has an amzing staff and management and I&#39;d like to thank the entirety of the staff for accommodating my family and extended family durring our visit.

Very slow. We waited for 30 minutes before the waiter came over to take our drink order. The waiter never even came to check on us at all. We had to ask another waiter to get us drinks, to get us boxes, and to get our check when that person wasn&#39;t even our waiter. Food is trash as well.

I enjoyed my visit for a late lunch. It was a day I gave myself to just enjoy life and I&#39;m so glad I choose The Cheesecake Factory. Their menu is a delight and so hard to choose from, so I choose a nice glass of Sirrah Red wine first to guide my selection. Both the greeter and the server were fabulous which went a long way to making good food taste even better. I finally decided upon the Spicy Caesar Salad and the Fried Calamari appetizer. Both were complimented by the wine I&#39;d ordered and the fresh hot bread with butter on the side. Even though the hour was late for lunch, the restaurant was maybe 25% full. Yet there was a quiet atmosphere in the booth in which I dined allowing me time for reflection. I will be back! I like the design of the restaurant and the chance for an intimate dining experience in most of the seating available. If only I had taken pictures. The food presentation was beautiful, so I just dug in and enjoyed the hard work of the meal preparers. It was all Yummy!

Keep coming back for the food and not service. Not trying to sound negative but it seems like every time we come in service gets worse. A huge pet peeve is that if you come in at 11am for lunch they will cram you in the back corner with everyone who comes in instead of utilizing the entire restaurant. Today we were given a broken glass to drink out of that was extremely sharp and they did not offer to bring us a new one.  The last time I was given a piece of shrapnel in my sandwich. I love the food here I hope this gets reviewed by upper management.
Restaurant was clean. All employees were pleasant. Chris, our server, was attentive and efficient!! The food was amazing!!

Came Here On March 15th, It Was A Group Of 7. Hostess Said It Was An Hour Wait. Which Is Understandable Since They Were Busy And I Had No Reservation For My Family. Once The Hour Past I Asked The Hostess If We Were Ready And She Rudely Said &#34;Um You Have 15 Minutes Left&#34; lol I&#39;m Just Like Okay That&#39;s Fine. We Got Sat, Our Server Robert Cha Was Great! Food Was Excellent. Drinks Were Amazing. Bill Was Like $165 For 7 People Which Was Not Bad, He Didn&#39;t Grat Us Which Amazed Me Since We Were A Bunch Of Mexicans lol So I Gave Him $200. Would Of Been 5 Stars But I Didn&#39;t Like The Hostess Attitude.

The only restaurant that I&#39;m 100% SURE sent me to the hospital with food poisoning.  DON&#39;T EAT THE RAW FISH!!  Aside from that, the majority of their food, while tasty, is fat- and-calorie laden, unhealthy fare.  Sorry to say, we&#39;ve taken this off of our list of Friday Night Out choices.  <br><br>NOT recommended.

I picked up dinner for four. I ordered the meatloaf. When I got home I could hardly believe what I got. Burnt, not charred, burnt both sides. If I cooked this at home I would not have served it and called out for pizza. They got two stars because of how polite the front staff was. The employee who put that crap in my to go box should be fired. I do not feel this is indicative to this corporation but I&#39;m hungry and pissed.

First night in Boise, decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory. Waited about 20 minutes....well worth the wait! Our server Allyson L. Was fantastic! Courteous, cheerful, honest! She was so busy but made my birthday extra special by going the extra mile!  She even carded me and I&#39;m well above legal age! Thank you Allyson &amp; Cheesecake efor a wonderful birthday!

Waited an hour for our food. The appetizer we got was crab cakes, which were frozen. When I got my pasta is was completely undercooked. The manager was really respectful after we expressed our complaints, but we won&#39;t be coming back here again for anything but the cheesecakes which are usually pretty damn good.

We had only been once before, the menu is overwhelming with something like 15 pages and 300 different food choices. Lisa narrowed it down to which pages to look at and the page that was her favorite which we were really grateful for. They were out of the chicken parmesan that I wanted but she was able to manipulate the menu and get me exactly what I wanted. Hands down favorite part of the experience was the service. Lisa was amazing and we will definitely be back just to see her <br>-Madi

Just like every Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been in, this was a good experience.  Always love the atmosphere, the awesome bread, the passion fruit tea and the very good service.<br><br>  Favorite part of our meal was when my precious daughter in law (who recently had a baby) said it was the best meal she&#39;d had in a long time.  (she had the seared tuna salad).  <br><br>  That being said, I had the shrimp scampi, herb crusted salmon combo and it was beyond rich.  Is it really necessary to bread and fry the shrimp before dousing it in a ton of butter?  (uh, don&#39;t answer that)...and the potatoes would have done so much better with less fat, also.  <br><br>  Husband&#39;s fried shrimp was not the best.  I know because I tried it.  He didn&#39;t complain however, as he was busy with his new grandbaby.<br><br>  Steak-lover in our group seemed pleased with his steak and said it was cooked right.<br><br>  Everyone agreed that the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake was right as right can be!

We were staying at a local hotel. After putting babies to bed we sent out for food. The cheesecake part of the Lemon Raspberry cheesecake wasn&#39;t set. Tamale corn cakes had hardly enough sour cream and salsa. No avocados. Pasta was good though.

You know when... you are at a Great Restaurant when the management has staffed the restaurant with truly great &amp; honest Servers who are looking out for their guests. We are visiting Idaho for the 1st time and what happen is a real great testimony to the citizens of this state.... (we are from Southern California where the outcome would have been different....)<br>My Daughter accidentally left her $200.00 Airpods at the table when we left on 8-14-19. (FYI... the Meals &amp; Drinks were great) Our Server (Her Name is April) picked up the AirPods and turned them into her manager. Since we love CheeseCake we decided to eat again tonight 8-15-19 and April saw us sitting down at another server&#39;s table and came over and told us she had found my Daughter&#39;s AirPods the night before!<br>I had figured the AirPods were lost... never to be seen again... and to have such an honest person come forward and do the right thing was just fantastic! <br>Living in Los Angeles you just don&#39;t see this type of action enough and you get hardened and learn to assume the worst... and get use to ... will i do not need to say anymore..<br>So to the management of this CheeseCake on North Milwaukee in Boise... Great Food &amp; Drinks and you have the BEST Server in Idaho .... and her name is April!<br><br>Koen

I love going to the Cheesecake Factory whenever I go somewhere that has one. I took my daughter and she loved it. Our waiter was awesome. We always had full drinks and was always asked if we needed anything else. Plus the food was great. Will be going back when we are in town.

There&#39;s not a bad thing on the menu. Great service and amazing food. Huge portions and reasonably priced. Favorites include: Steak Diane, Coconut Thai Chicken, and  Chicken Madeira. Cheesecake: Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch

I had to call twice for a refund on the cheesecake that they left out. Still no refund. Not great customer service and our food was thrown away it was so bad. I cannot believe we aren&#39;t getting our money back. Someone contacted me on here telling me to contact them on their website and again, well over a week with no response. We won&#39;t come back and we won&#39;t let our friends go either.

Typically I avoid the Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s a bit overwhelming and past experiences have been unremarkable. However, while visiting family in Boise we decided to go to Cheesecake Factory for lunch since it could accommodate our whole party (12 adults, 5 kids). It was lunchtime but kind of late and in the middle of the week so it wasn&#39;t too busy. We were able to get a table within about 5 minutes. Our party arrived in waves which I think benefited us and the wait staff and kitchen because we all ordered as we arrived and none of us had to wait for our food for a long time. <br>Myself and my mother-in-law have to eat a modified diet and were able to find entrees that worked with our needs.<br>Our waiter was very attentive and great with all of us. He was patient with the kids and the mess we all made. All in all it was a good visit.

Whoops. Put in the wrong review for the wrong place. Here is an update and the correct review: <br><br>I have been on the road raising awareness for veterans with PTSD and veteran suicide since November 2016. I walked across America twice and am now on a bicycle for the last 9,000 miles. I was lucky to have been able to eat here. The staff was great and is a true reflection on the management here which I was also able to meet. They are kind and a joy to talk with. I sat at the bar and it was easy to have a conversation with the bartender. I asked what newer things were on the menu and he was all over it. He suggested the pineapple chicken and shrimp. I look over the menu and told him to pick one of the three I saw. He suggested the same dish again. I am very thankful I took his advice! The dish was one of the better dishes I have had in a very long time. Most of the time I can not finish a plate. This was so good that it was all gone before I even knew it! The back of the house did a fantastic job!! I can&#39;t say enough great things about my experience here. You must stop by and try this dish if you are in the area!

This is our second time in four days visiting this restaurant and both times we were not impressed. We had eaten there for both lunch &amp; dinner service and even though not slammed it took FOREVER to be seated, once seated it took FOREVER to be approached for our drink order or even just an introduction.  My coffee cup had something on the inside of the glass and the salmon with mashed potatoes were drenched in oil, looked ugly to eat and made us sick! The restroom was out of soap on Fri and on Mon it was still empty... coincidence I would have guessed but now I think not! The service was fine once it got going and the cheesecakes are always delish other then that this place has been removed from our list of fav places to eat when visiting Boise.
Had the crispy fried Mac &amp; Cheese balls and shared a slice of Cinnabon Cinnamon Swirl Cheesecake. Both were absolutely delicious

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory several times and this is the first time I&#39;ve been so disgusted with the service that I&#39;ll probably never go back. When we arrived there was no hostess. The nice young lady behind the bakery counter actually seated us. After 5-10 minutes our waiter finally came to the table. We told him we wanted espresso and the. He informed us that they may have already shut the machines down and he would go check. Another 5-10 minutes passed before he brought water. And informed us it would be a 5-10 minutes wait on the coffee. Then approximately 35 minutes after we arrived he finally brought our espressos and took our cheesecake orders. We only half finished our cheesecake and asked him for boxes. He did box them up and brought them back with our checks. After another 10-15 minutes wait we took our checks to the bartender area to have them process our payments. I&#39;m thoroughly aggravated with the service and will tell all of my family to avoid going there unless they want to have terrible service.

Horrible service Oscar G 0551..you are as personable as a rock. You didn&#39;t bring the bread we asked for. We waited an hour and forty-five minutes for our food. The chicken was burnt and you only filled our water glasses after you brought us the check. It was a horribly expensive meal...yikes...I will not go back ever

My husband and I were leaving the mall and decided let&#39;s grab a bite. The weekend before Christmas was crazy and getting out of the mall was more than I could take.  We were sat immediately.  Our server Sara had the personality of oatmeal. She clearly does not like being a server and is less than ambivalent about serving. Ok. Our server and food were cut from the same cloth. Mediocre at best and lacking in personality or flavir. We sent back the guacamole made to order. Spicy means it tastes as spicy as oatmeal. We get it back and it&#39;s still oatmeal. We asked for onion, cilantro and green chillies which we received.  Once we remade the guac. It was better. However I was over the place. My husband thought his martini was OK. So I stated let&#39;s get outta here. <br><br>Bottom line: go to a diner you will get the same quality in Food.

Fuck. That&#39;s probably not enough for a review. So, here&#39;s a list of grievances: extremely poor and dim lighting, nearly offensively so. Obscenely slow kitchen. The microwaves can&#39;t all be that slow. Sure, it&#39;s an excessive menu, but really, I could have driven somewhere else, returned with food and eaten it all before the dishes got to the table. Wait staff was solid, but unspectacular, though I will note she tried (and missed) very hard for charming. Points for effort there...kinda.<br><br>Calamari was ok and so was the Bang Bang dish. It was billed as chicken and shrimp, but what they really meant was a pepper coconut cream vaguely sort of curry sauce, substandard rice, a half-handful of small chicken chunks and 2 shrimp. Joy. The salted caramel cheesecake is probably floating around somewhere in one of those circles of Hell, though the middle part wasn&#39;t totally offensive. This place is also stupidly overpriced and I really don&#39;t know what it is, but the only good locations I&#39;ve been to of these places has been on the East Coast...not sure why, but every location I&#39;ve been to out West has simply not gotten it...if you feel like throwing a pile of money at mediocre junk, here you go.

Once again disappointed by the service, food, and management at Cheesecake Factory. We decided to try this place again after the first time we didn&#39;t get greeted for 35minutes no waters no bread no anything when we did the waiter blamed the hostess and then when we did get our food my pasta had three different noodles than the ones that were supposed to be in the pasta and my fiancé&#39;s food steal was cold. THIS VISIT... we got sat and greeted fast. We ordered promptly cause we already knew what we wanted to eat. (We are watching our food intake so requested no bread. )We ordered a  medium rare and rare steak... 15min go by our waitress says our food will be right out.... 23min go by still no food. Finally the manager on duty comes by after 25min and says he is sorry our food should be right out, I told him it&#39;s okay we may just leave... he says I would hate for you to leave hungry.... LEAVE HUNGRY I&#39;m thinking?? I&#39;ve been sitting here for almost 30min waiting for a steak that should have taken 6min and 4min to cook.. I&#39;m past being hungry I have to be in work in an hour and a half. We leave before getting our food. Never will I be going back to this restaurant sorry but I will not be disappointed again, love your cheesecake but I will not support a place who can not take care of there guests in a timely manner especially when the restaurant isn&#39;t even full. Did I mention both times we came it was beginning of the lunch shift so it&#39;s not like they are slammed... good luck Cheesecake Factory.

Came here because of a cravings a family member had. It was fine. a ok. nothing better to say really. their tables are oddly big and its very hard to talk to each other especially since the music is so loud and the atmosphere is so &#34;romantic&#34;. meaning... dark. i hardly saw my menu. i really get upset when its too dark in a restaurant. when I&#39;m hungry i expect to see the menu and the food i get served. Makes me paranoid when i cant see what i eat or if the place is clean. feels like they are hiding something :). The food wasn&#39;t bad. I had salmon with brown rice and they didn&#39;t over cook the fish. no fry sauce. what?! had to explain what it was. Cheesecake was dry, way too sweet and tasted old. fail on desert that supposed to be their signature dish. quite pricey too. big portions.
Great service, great food as always. Ordered miso salmon and it was awesome. Glad I ordered the lunch portion because it was still a lot of food. Definitely going back on my next visits.

We come here often for dinner but this time just popped in for dessert and coffee. One of our favorite go-to&#39;s when we&#39;re at or near the mall. They&#39;re always super busy so you can usually expect a short wait. The lemon raspberry cheesecake is always a good stand-by and you can&#39;t go wrong with with carrot cake cheese cake! And they have good coffee too!

My favorite place to eat! I love to get the chicken carrots and mashed potatoes. They have a wonderful GF menu. They actually have GF dessert that isn&#39;t ice cream. Their portion sizes are very generous. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Two hours from walk-in to when the food arrived, pasta was cold, congealed and gummy.  Shrimp was overcooked.  Food had clearly been sitting under the lamps, undelivered, for a while.  By this point it was almost 9pm and waiting for new food was out of the question.  All of us took a couple of bites, ordered our cheesecake to go (took another 25 minutes) and left.  $220 bill an everyone left hungry.  Will never be back.
We are having the best dinner ever and Alan Johnson is by far the best waiter I have ever had. Got the bread right away and the food is hot. Definitely ask for his section..

My husband ate here last night and have decided we will come back more often for dinners. I ordered the very simple sounding Herb Crusted filet of salmon and was blown away! The presentation was beautiful. The salmon over the mashed potatoes was the top of a jellyfish and the &#34;tentacles&#34; were the asparagus! The lemon sauce made my taste buds sing and I have NEVER had a salmon cooked so perfectly. It was so moist and tender. Kudos to the chef on that masterpiece!<br>My husband had the Chicken Bellagio and that&#39;s what I&#39;m going to get next time I ago. Another seriously top-notch dish! The wait staff was solid (and sported lots of tattoos!) and I love the atmosphere in there. The lighting is gorgeous, in my opinion, although I did notice a nearby customer using the flashlight feature on his phone to read the menu! As always, the cheesecake didn&#39;t disappoint. <br>We will definitely be back!

I&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory before, so I&#39;ve never understood the hype. <br><br>This location is near my office, so my boss recently treated me to lunch here. <br><br>The staff was wonderful! They were all very friendly, attentive, and quick. It was a gorgeous day, so we opted to sit out on the patio, which was just lovely. <br><br>The menu was expansive - like, excessively so - but it gave me a lot of options to choose from, as I&#39;m limiting/excluding certain foods from my diet currently. <br><br>I ended up ordering the Grilled Chicken Lettuce Wraps - Mexican style. YUM! I was a little disappointed with the small amount of chicken in each one, but the flavor was incredible. I could have eaten another plate of them.... or two. <br><br>It&#39;s a little on the expensive side, which I think will be the only hindrance on future returns. But, I&#39;ll certainly be trying that famous cheesecake down the road..

The food is over priced and they messed up several of our orders. The staff was great. My brother in law found half a plastic bread tie in his food. A complete accident and I get things happen. Im probably one of the easiest going understanding customers and even I was really disappointed.

Well, it&#39;s a chain. So you&#39;re going to get the full chain experience. However, the Pasta D&#39;Vinci remains, hands down, my very favorite chain dish. I love the Boise location, the patio is fantastic! Nothing &#34;special&#34;, but, hey, sometimes you just want consistency.
Still our fav for a few drinks and bs talk old fashion booths make it cool prices high but food still going Steady

I always enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory.  Expect to wait if there is a special event (half price Cheesecake day for example) or its a busy Friday or Saturday night.  This wouldn&#39;t be so bad if the lobby had a bit more seating.  Often you have to stand because all the benches are taken.  The servers are usually very friendly.  There has only been one time I can think of where we felt a bit forgotten by our server.  The food is always fresh and flavorful and I love all the variety.  The cheesecake is great but expensive so we don&#39;t always indulge.  Last time we went was half price cheesecake day and it was very busy, waited about an hour to be seated but the hostesses kept us updated and they got me some water while I waited (I was 9 months pregnant) and I thought our server was very attentive.  He made sure our cups were always filled and we had plenty of bread while we waited for our meal.

We arrived at about 10pm, keep in mind they close at 11. Upon arrival no hostess was present. A nice woman from the bakery/ to go order area sat us at a table. Then after about 5 mins the waiter came over and tried to take our drink order. He tells us that the coffee machine is being cleaned and he would need to check to see if he could even get us coffee. After about 10 mins he returns saying he can and then we order coffee and water which he says will take about 10 mins to make because the machine was being cleaned. About 10 mins later he takes our order for cheesecake. And another 15 goes by before we receive our coffee. After we start eating and decide to take the rest of our cheesecake home he takes 10 mins to box them and give us our bills. Now we wait for 10 mins and he still doesn&#39;t show to process our bills. We had to track down the original woman who was at the bar to help us. He then shows up and processes our bills. Two of us paid with cards and my mother in cash. He then says he has to go find a drawer to get cash from and takes another 10 mins just to get that. Food was good but seriously need to step it up in the service department.

I have had two really excellent experiences at the CCF recently! The first one, was a delish brunch on Sunday! Peach Bellini + Monte Cristo French Toast. Does it get any better than that? I think not! You have to try the french toast! So delish. <br><br>I brought my brother and his girlfriend here for a dinner &amp; we had a great time. Our server Isaiah, was amazing! He gets a big shout out. He made our whole dinner experience great. More peach bellinis &amp; laughs all around! Thank you for making our time together even better! We love sitting outside &amp; the food is always great!

What&#39;s not to LOVE about the Cheesecake Factory? They have a great menu - I had the chicken parmigiana pizza style and of course cheesecake for desert. The staff was friendly and service was great and the food was awesome!! We try to go there every trip to Boise plus it&#39;s right at the mall so walk off the lunch or dinner shopping at the mall.
I eat here often as the food is delicious and they have great customer service! A few times they messed up my order but they quickly fixed it and took responsibility.

I just wanted to update. I spoke with the manager Melanie  and she was so sweet! She apologized for everything that happened and made the situation right! Will continue to dine here because for one the food is amazing and for 2 it&#39;s obvious management really does care!

The Cheesecake Factory has been at the Boise Towne Square Mall for almost ten years now.  My first experience was such that I didn&#39;t want to go back there.  The portions were huge although tasty and it just appeared that mega amounts of food and dessert was the idea here.<br><br>We&#39;ve been here recently for lunch and ordered from the Skinnylicious menu tasting wonderful salads and flatbreads with a smaller calorie output.  Today we opted for brunch which is only served on Sundays here.  Normally this restaurant opens at 11 AM but on Sundays opening time is 10 AM.  Compared to other popular and crowded breakfast places around here this one was fairly quiet and we didn&#39;t have to wait!<br><br>Coffee was robust and fresh.  The orange juice was freshly squeezed.   We ordered.   My husband and I shared a Spinach, bacon, mushroom and cheese omelet and an order of lemon ricotta pancakes.  Our son opted for a Chorizo and Avocado omelet.   Egg orders come with sides of fried potatoes and a choice of bread.<br><br>The omelets were nice and fluffy and we all enjoyed the combinations we ordered.   The lemon ricotta pancakes were thin, almost crepe like  and came with a small carafe of heated maple syrup.  There was a sprinkling of powdered sugar on the plate and sliced strawberries.  I used about a tablespoon of syrup and honestly wouldn&#39;t have needed any since the pancakes on their own were very light, with a touch of lemon and perfectly delicious!<br><br>When we finished, the server asked if we&#39;d like to see a dessert menu.   It was out of the question---we were full!  I&#39;m thinking that the Cheesecake Factory should change it&#39;s name.   There are definitely so many choices on the menu and healthy ones.   There are even calorie counts listed after the items.  Very helpful to those of us wanting to keep the carbs, fats, and calories under control.   And if you really want a special treat after that----there is always cheesecake!

After our prior incident and sending the Corp. Office a copy of the Yelp review. AND: After 4 calls I made to them in the last two weeks / Finally a return call today: They made it right and sent their apologies along with an electronic gift card, via email.<br>We hope to go back and have a better &#34;over all&#34; experience!

I enjoyed eating here with my wife.  The service was awesome thanks Veronica and the food was delicious.  I was so full I had no room for cheese cake!  Also any business that donates to veteran events like this one has are a 5 star in my book!  I appreciate any businesses who supports and continues to support our veterans who have served our country.  I would recommend this place and will keep returning.
Best food in town, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal. <br>Iwish  seating were more private but it is nice Place besides this issue.
The food was good enough... the lighting was awful. <br><br>Not sure why the lighting is so bad. Maybe they forgot to pay the power bill.

Seated promptly even though it was Black Friday and crowded.  Our server, Lisa C was very knowledgeable with the menu and made some recommendations that we were very happy with.  New to the area, we asked here about living there and she was extremely helpful as to where to live and dine.<br><br>Tuna carpaccio was very tasty, herb crusted salmon cooked to perfection, stuffed chicken tortillas had great flavor.  I would definitely go back.
Order food to go tonight. Asked for bread and butter and it didn&#39;t get put in the bag. Ordered fish and chips and no chips. Honestly what a disappointment

Well, a little surprised to be honest.   Sat at the bar where there are two bartenders and 3 customers.  I ordered a beer and some food.  The bartender did not make up a place setting for me ( which others had and is customary).  Food came quickly as did my drink.  I asked for a bottle beer and a glass.  I had to pour it myself.  No one checked on me.  I had to get their attention for salt/pepper and for a soda.  Plan on getting dessert to go.  Wish they were more focused on the customers in front of them.

I&#39;m not a fan of this place. <br><br>I&#39;ve heard a lot of hub-bub about the Cheesecake factory and how great it is butttttt...I don&#39;t see it. The only reason I&#39;m giving it 2 stars is because our server was AMAZING and the Lemoncello cake was really good. But the food was terrible, and so was the seating.<br><br>I never realized how important it is to be comfortable when you eat until I came here. We were seated in the corner booth closest to the hostess area. Now when I think of a booth I think of comfy, lush seating. NO. It was harder than sitting on the ground. It hurt!!! I had to sit on my sweater in order to stay because my butt AND my back were KILLING me within the first 10 minutes. And I&#39;m only 25 years old, so I cant imagine older folks trying to settle in and have a good meal here. <br><br>Our server was incredible. He was very attentive and tried his best to help answer our questions about their ridiculously HUGE menu....there are more than 12 pages...and most of them are advertisements...Yup. That&#39;s what I want while I&#39;m eating, to look at advertisements for other places in town. What is this, Las Vegas!? No. It&#39;s Idaho. <br><br>First we ordered the Crispy Crab wontons as an appetizer. I should have assumed that a restaurant that had everything from Chinese to Mexican would be a jack of all trades and a king of none... The wontons themselves were flavorless and chunky. Not what I look for when I&#39;m eating a cream cheese and crab wonton. The dough was cooked too long so it had a slightly burnt taste too it and it was way too thick to begin with. The sauce was really runny and was not sweet and sour but more of a soy sauce and sweet...not tasty. <br><br>For dinner I ordered the Pasta Carbonara and a side salad with ranch. My salad came out with the &#34;wontons&#34; and the salad was wet. They had pre-dressed the salad too so all the dressing was runny and the leafs were all soggy...all I kept thinking was &#34;I&#39;m spending $6 on a salad that I could have made for 25cents at home..and it would be tastier.&#34;....sad thoughts. <br><br>Next....the Carbonara...sigh. What a disappointment. The sauce was like water. I know why they give you a spoon...it&#39;s so you can pick up the milky watery sauce from the bottom of the bowl and spoon it over the pasta...yum...*sarcasm*. The pasta was cooked well but there was no flavor but fat coming through to me. It just tasted horrendous. <br><br>My friend ordered the Garlic Noodles upon recommendation from our server. YUCK. I was so grossed out by the flavor profile of this. It was like eating the remnants of an old gym sock. Oh and also - if no one tells you, when you order chicken on your pasta, there will be bones. No one told us this. We had some fun with that. :/<br><br>Again, like I said, our server was great and the cake we ate was delicious. I will go back for dessert, and nothing else. And it will be to-go because the seating there is horrendous.
Was disappointed at first but they took good care of us! The wait time was long but our waitress made it very pleasant!

Tonight was our Family&#39;s first time to the Cheesecake Factory.  I was so excited because all I have heard was how good it is. Well, we were seated within five minutes, which was good, the waitress came up asked us for our drinks,  became combative with my husband,  was short with us and seemed like she was irritated with us the whole time because my husband wasn&#39;t ready to order a drink yet. We overheard a manager and waitresses talk bad about another Customer. We were seated by the back till, overheard All the waitress talk bad about their customers, along with the bust boys.  Watched the manager go back and forth with a large amount of keys hooked to her pants, back and forth, stomping like she was a little girl not getting her way. We watched the bust boys take 10-15 minutes to bust a table, and continued to get glared at by our waitress. Then what really tipped it to a bad experience is that the our waitress kept reaching over my husband and he kept smelling her gross, smelly, armpit.  How is that for your food? I always wanted to go but not now. We will never go back and we spent over a hundred dollars with no dessert. The good thing is, food was good.  Give the cook credit where it belongs. Sorry Cheesecake Factory for leaving a bad taste in my mouth.

I LOVE the cheesecake here so I was disappointed last night when my friend found a hair in her food. We were all pretty disgusted but shook it off and still had a great time. The waiter didn&#39;t offer to replace her food or refund the money when he found out about the incident. It happens, I thought. Unfortunately today while enjoying my leftovers for lunch, I found a coarse, black hair mixed in the herb topping on my herb crusted salmon. Two hairs?!? I am thoroughly grossed out and if I ever return, it will be to get cheesecake to go.

Came in for dinner with my boyfriend, we started off with mai tais and an appetizer. The drinks were good, (although not too stiff for their 10$ a piece price point). I understand that upscale restaurants often don&#39;t list the prices of their cocktails, but come on.. We are talking about a chain restaurant that shares walls with mall stores. I&#39;d like to see how much I&#39;m dropping on one drink without having to ask. So that was a little annoying, but our food was tasty enough. We had the buffalo blasts app, and I ordered the farfalle pasta with chicken and garlic and my bf ordered the Kobe beef burger with a salad. We both got cheesecake to go and it was decent, but really for how much everything cost us it could have been a bit better. Especially at a place named for cheesecake, lol. Anyways, next time we want to spend nearly 100$ on one meal we&#39;ll go to The Melting Pot or Chandlers.
Omg...what a great meal. The atmosphere was nice and it allows us girls to catch up. The portions were more than we could eat and we had to take our cheesecake home. We will definitely be going back.

Food is ok. Service is ok. Nothing great or spectacular. Especially for the price. If you get pasta or any saucy food don&#39;t let them store it for leftovers to take home... you won&#39;t get any of the sauce for leftovers, only the dry pasta.

We stopped in after a rough day, and they were wonderful!! We had some special requests and they got our order spot on! If you are vegetarian, then this is the best chain restaurant to get a veggie burger. It is not a frozen, processed bun. They make it at the restaurant and it has a LOT of flavor!! Loved it!!  <br><br>Make sure you enjoy the company of your party, because the building doesn&#39;t have very good cell signal, and you won&#39;t be able to bury your face in your smart phone. Not recommended for blind dates!<br><br>We told the waiter that they need to get wi-fi, because we couldn&#39;t make our hotel reservations.  He offered to let us use his phone from another carrier. We declined, be were very appreciative of the gesture. <br><br>Last but not least, don&#39;t leave without some cheesecake.  They&#39;re all good!!<br><br>P. S. Please let me know if they ever get wi-fi, and I&#39;ll change my rating to 5 stars.

They made a mistake on my wife&#39;s order by delivering her meal to the wrong table. (It happens, no big deal). The waiter, assistant manager, and manager all apologized, and handle the situation very professionally.  We plan on going back, great food.

Celebrating family on their last night in town and everyone wants something different. Been thinking of trying the factory for a while and figured this would be a good a time as any. <br>Cheesecake Factory gets a bad rap for a number of things, the first thing being the length of their menu. And yeah, it&#39;s the first thing I thought of when I heard we were going there, and yes it is very very long, but the staff there embraced it. They themselves referred to their menus as novels. Way to roll with the punches there Cheesecake Factory. <br>It was surprisingly busy for a Wednesday night. The food was great and the staff was sharp. The portions were perfect and it wasn&#39;t as expensive as I thought it would be. Over all, I didn&#39;t have a bad time. I actually had a decently pretty good experience. You know this chain, you know what you&#39;re gonna get. It&#39;s the Olive Garden plus ten. Worth at least one shot.
A restaurant that is a little on the high end but the food and the service never disappoints. The inside is very spacious just a little loud for my taste at times.

Went in for dinner and ordered the NY steak MR. Steak was cooked well done, server checked about 5 minutes later. Took the steak back, left the mashed potatoes and broccoli for me to eat while waiting for the new steak to arrive. 10 minutes later new steak arrived, I am the only one eating at the table. No apology from manager for a horrible experience. Paid the full price and left.

So everyone knows I worked at the Cheesecake. The food is great but the Cheesecake is not made here or all restaurants really. They have a factory in California and others where they mass produce then, freeze them and send them out. They are only decorated at the Cheesecake Factory. All the dessert are shipped frozen. It still good food but not fresh desserts.

Ordered eggs Benedict with grilled chicken and breakfast diced potatoes. When it came the hollandaise sauce was broken and my entire plate was full of oil. The potatoes were undercooked and hard. The chicken overdone and chewy. They did replace my plate and gave me gravy instead. The waiter was nice. I wouldn&#39;t go back.
We were a group of people and had very good experience visiting the place. Service was quick and food was quite decent for a chain of restraunt.
Love this food chain. Taste has always been consistent. I&#39;ve been to least five different locations. Ordered same food. They&#39;ve never let me down so far.

Cheesecake Factory what else can I say? Lol. Everything is massive here from the cheesecake slices, portion sizes and even the menu is massive like a huge book. There menu has so much to offer I try to find something new every time I go. So this time I had the spicy New Orleans pasta. I actually found it last minute boy I was glad o did it was delicious!! It comes with a nicely breaded Parmesan chicken and the sauce is perfect the heat doesn&#39;t overwhelm you/take away from the flavors of the dish. I only ate half I mean you can&#39;t not eat here and not get Cheesecake lol. Our waitress was very attentive and was right on the with the water and even went the extra mile she put our slices of cheesecake in to-go containers so we&#39;d be ready to go and since we only planned to eat half. I ordered the seasonal pumpkin pecan cheesecake-omg that was incredible!! Do yourself a favor grab a slice before it&#39;s gone!! If your looking for a nice night out either for just desert or for dinner this is the place!!

We came in on a Saturday night, a group of 5 people and were told that there would be a 10-15 minute wait. We waited about 30 minutes and no one ever let us know that the wait would be longer. All we saw was that every one else that came in after us got seated well before us so that was quite frustrating. The manager came out to apologize but didn&#39;t offer any resolution. Not good customer service. HOWEVER, if you can overlook that, the quality of the food was good and our server Chuck had great customer service.

I had the PASTA WITH SHRIMP AND SAUSAGE. Made with rigatoni pasta, shrimp, and Italian sausage, the generous portion was covered in a rich and spicy marinara sauce that was delicious. Our server was Forest, his customer service was excellent.

Just finished a great dinner here with my wife. The service was very good and the meal was exceptional! We both had the shrimp scampi cooked in butter and garlic. The meal came with bread and butter and we also enjoyed a dish of chicken pot stickers. Everything was excellent. We were seated in the back where it was very cozy for us. The only drawback was the background music was a bit load and although in or youth we enjoyed the music load, we are seniors and prefer a more subtle and softer music. Other than that, we both love the place. Pricey but the meals were worth it! Of course we will be back.

Wow, the menu prices are really high now. So, if you think you can go in the appetizer page and find something reasonable, forget it. Appetizers are almost as much as full menu entrees. We ordered the fish tacos and Cuban sandwich. Tacos were okay but sandwich was very salty. Our bill was $31.15. I gave the waitress two twenty dollar bills. She took the money and never came back. A $9 tip? That would be a 30% tip without even asking. I had to find the woman and ask her to bring back the change. Got hit on both ends....high prices and aggressive tip-greedy servers.
Always too much food but it&#39;s great.  Less atmosphere and better food portions would be my focus.  Sometimes chains get too big and forget their customer service

I got food poisoning on May 6th because of their pasta. I was throwing up all night and had a severe upset stomach for days that I became dehydrated and had to goto the ER for fluids. Even then, I was off because of how much electrolytes I had lost. That&#39;s the last time I had Cheesecake Factory.. I had the Four Cheese pasta, never again. Prior to this I loved Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll have it again at some point. Just never that pasta.

IM OBSESSED WITH CHEESECAKE FACTORY. But seriously, it&#39;s my husband and my favorite place to eat out, despite it being somewhat expensive. My favorite meal is the spicy cashew chicken. It is loaded with delicious flavor. Another good thing about cheesecake factory is the fact that they have huge portion sizes so I&#39;ve always had leftovers. The service is great-- the staff has always been polite and attentive. I&#39;ve always had very positive experiences there.

I dont go here very often anymore. Its not that its not a good place, because it is. They just took my favorite dish of the menu.
