My wife loves it here and I know why.<br><br>The decorations are nice, its clean and the servers that I have run into are super friendly.<br><br>One thing that I love (I cant recall if its this one or not that does it) are servers that knell down to table level to take your order. I love this. I have only seen 1 restaurant do it. I think it makes servers seem more friendly. <br><br>There are a lot of places out there that are not clean, the wait staff are not user friendly, and the food is bad.<br><br>When you find one that wins in all these categories, it makes me want to mark it as a keeper.<br><br>The only reason I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because they took Carmel Chicken off the menu. <br><br>Carmel Chicken was like an upscale General Tso&#39;s Chicken. A really bad name for a really excellent dish.<br><br>Speaking of the menu here, its huge. Its one of the biggest menus I have ever seen. How they pull off keeping so much food on hand and having cook staff able to cook each one so well, I have no clue.<br><br>I am not a fan of Restaurant chains. But in the case of this place, I cant find any faults with them.<br><br>I an not much of a drinker, but I do like an occasional cocktail. I have the Pina Colada here and its awesome. <br><br>Like another restaurant that I wont mention, this place knows how to make one without using a mix.<br><br>On my last visit, I had the Mac and Cheese Burger. It might sound odd, but you need to have this. They burger is topped with their fried Mac and cheese balls and some of the sauce. The balls are crunchy and cheesy. <br><br>The burger is charbroiled. Its smoky and flavorful. If I was to give one negative, I would say that the cheese sauce over powers the burger a bit.<br><br>But then again, its cheese! Is there such a thing as too much cheese?<br><br>The other down side I will give is that its on the pricy side. The bill for the 3 of us (One of which is a 10 year old) was $40. A stretch if you are on a budget.<br><br>But in my opinion, this place is worth the splurge. And dont even get me started on their cheese cakes. If you love Cheese cake, trust me, you will want to come here

Had great lunch with the girls that included my &#34;standard&#34; Miso salmon over mashed potatoes (vs the rice that doesn&#39;t always seem to be right) but the salmon cooked perfectly as usual.  Everyone else&#39;s lunch very good. ..orange chicken with sweet potato fries, Cashew chicken salad (honestly the chicken was forgotten but promptly brought out) the waitress was ok...she had a grenadine explosion on the front of her white outfit (not bad just little spatters) but oddly the rest of her looked kinda dirty..weird..like rolled out of bed and put yesterday&#39;s clothes on. .the apron pretty gross..anyway..food very good just very surprised at cleanliness of waitress (who had no name tag and didn&#39;t announce her name). Thank goodness for the shared lemon raspberry &amp; red velvet cheescake; divine! Made everything right!

Food is awesome! ALWAYS. <br><br>What isn&#39;t awesome? Getting charged for a different tables bill and the manager Laurel arguing with me on the phone that she&#39;s &#34;too busy&#34; to get to a POS system and fix it. Heres the best part, gave her my number TWICE so that I could get a call back, and sure enough, Laurel didn&#39;t have enough time to call me back. Call again and spoke to a male manager, and he was AWESOME. Gave me the person to contact. <br><br>What makes me maddest? Not that the charge is STILL on my card 2 weeks later, not that Laurel has ZERO customer service skills, but that I called corporate TWICE and neither person I left a message for had the time to call me back.<br><br>Sorry, your food is great, and if your customer service skills were great too... I&#39;d support you. Alas, I&#39;ll eat elsewhere. Since you were too busy to call me back or  refund my money I&#39;m conveniently too busy to give you any of my business. There are PLENTY of restaurants with great food that also have awesome customer service. I&#39;d be empathetic of Laurel if she was even remotely human towards me, but it got personal on the phone and for that I say.. Get rid of her. Do your staff and your business a favor.
Service is extremely slow no matter what time of the day you come. Lunch prices are a little spendy but dessert is always amazing

Cheesecake Factory is excellent. Service is outstanding and food is alway on point.  Took the girls today for recognition lunch and they all had cheesecake before their lunch.  So I recommend this to everyone! Cheesecake before your lunch is the key to a great lunch.

I LOVE this place. The service isn&#39;t always great but their food is amazing! I get the same thing every time, Chicken Marsala. My mouth waters every time. I don&#39;t drink alcohol so often times I&#39;ll get a non-alcoholic strawberry daiquiri, I know it&#39;s all sugar, but sometimes even a drink that&#39;s all sugar is hard to do. I&#39;ve been here for birthday, anniversary, graduation dinners, SO good. Their only flaw I would say is they struggle taking care of big groups sometimes, and they are a little pricey. But for the BEST chicken Marsala in the valley, totally worth it.

Can&#39;t believe I haven&#39;t written a review for this place yet!! I love Cheese cake factory. The food doesn&#39;t disappoint. I&#39;ve tried so many things and I&#39;m always happy. I come for happy hour at least 4 times a month and dinner at least 2 times a month. I get the cosmopolitan..... get a cocktail with your meal any one is usually good! I had to knock a star because sometimes the service is super slow. I once sat at a bar top and saw my drink that I ordered 10-15 mins ago just sitting at the bar pass dying while other less busy servers were just standing waiting for their drinks. As a server it pains me to watch this. It literally would&#39;ve taken two seconds for one of them to deliver it to us and help their fellow server out. I had to get up and ask the bartender to grab our drinks for us. One bad experience doesn&#39;t take away from this place though. I would recommend sharing a slice of cheesecake (I can never finish one).

I&#39;d only been here once before (years ago) and was put off by all the huge, meaty dishes. So glad I went back! Their new &#34;skinny&#34; menu has some amazing vegetarian options. I had spring rolls, the pear/bleu cheese/caramelized onion flatbread, a glass of Syrah and of course, cheesecake. It was all delicious.<br><br>They even brought a baby plate to keep my son entertained while we waited. But despite it being a busy Friday night, our service was prompt. I&#39;m definitely looking forward to going back.

What you&#39;d expect of an enormous chain restaurant, minus the service snafus.  Appetizer was taken off the check since, well, i didn&#39;t want my appetizer after my meal.  I was more or less pretty pleased having a lunch date here with my little one until my husband texted me, as he was having lunch at Momofuku.  What a buzzkill.

My husband, son, and I visited the Cheesecake Factory and were unfortunately very disappointed. Our waiter was very friendly but checked in on us way too frequently. So much so that we felt very rushed and a little uncomfortable. Our conversations were constantly interrupted and as we rarely go out to dinner, it was frustrating to have this special time feel so hurried. There were plenty of open tables. I ordered the French Dip sandwich and was surprised to see that for $14, it came on a hamburger bun! My husband&#39;s small generic beer was $6.25. He normally pays $4 at the local brew pub for excellent craft beer. We ordered a piece of cheesecake to go and it was a disappointment as well: half the size of the pieces we saw other patrons in the restaurant enjoying. For $8, I should not have that tiny of a piece especially since this is the Cheesecake Factory.
Cheesecake Factory is my fallback. We are never disappointed with the food or service.

I Love This place. It is one of my favorite places. My Ex Fiance&#39; Ashlynn and I would eat here a lot before I lost her in a horrifying Car Accident we were both in 8 Months ago. I try to stop by here frequently even if just for a Slice of Pie. To remember her. The Staff are great and the atmosphere friendly. The first time we came was because we were Fans of the Show the Big Bang Theory. Please stop by during happy hour for half priced Apps.
The cashier at the bakery did not give one rate about me. I was shocked at my treatment they were so busy I was more like I was just in the way.
Slowest service ever.  No way that Fish tacos should take more than 40 minutes to come out of kitchen.

My mom is in town and we were treating her to a special dinner for her birthday. We were told right as we sat down that they were out of most steak and salmon dishes. Ok, no problem. We looked over the menu for a while and finally decided. My husband tried to order the bang bang chicken and shrimp, only to be told they were out of that too. He finally decided on the burrito. We all get our food after a long wait and my husbands burrito was lukewarm. He hated to say anything because we all had our food finally and he knew it would take a while to get it back. Sure enough we were all done with our food before he even got his, which was just the same burrito heated up. We ordered cheesecakes, which tasted great but the coffee we got with it wasn&#39;t even hot. The manager spoke with us and said sorry about the burrito, but that was it. She seemed to have her hands full with a lot of people being upset about the lack of food options being available. I think we should have been offered a discount or something but the waiter and manager honestly seemed to care less. I would definitely avoid this location if you actually want to order food and eat it together.

The food was pretty good, especially the cheesecake, but the service was awful.  First, there were no reservations in the evening.  When I called three days prior, they told me there were no reservations, but that I should call an hour before our party of 9 was planning to arrive.  When I followed their request, the person who answered the phone was fairly belligerent, telling me that they did not take reservations (which I already knew) and that I couldn&#39;t expect them to save a table.  I tried to explain that I was only following instructions, but they demanded to know who I had talked to.  How would I know?  I talked to the person who answered the phone three days prior!  We arrived at 6:15, weren&#39;t seated until 7pm, didn&#39;t receive our food until 8pm, and had to wait a long time for them to take our dessert order.  It was very noisy, the decaf coffee was stale, the chairs were unsuitable for a long time sitting, the service was slow and sparse.  We finally left a full three hours after we had arrived.  A very disappointing experience.  We&#39;ll choose somewhere else next time!
We had excellent service by the waiting staff.  And the food was surprisingly delicious!  My girlfriend and I lingered over the cheesecake menu and came away from the whole experience delighted.
Yesterday my husband and I ate at this location for lunch .. the food was awesome and we had the nicest waiter .. he was super nice .. thank you ..

The service was excellent, our waiter was very friendly and patient with us. When we had questions he was quick to help with the answers ain&#39;t explaining the menu and giving recommendations. The good was well prepared and made just as ordered. I would come back again just for the service.

I hate even giving them a 1 Star! I had a day to go on a date with my two year old grandson. After which we were going to the aquarium. I have been looking forward to this date with my little man for a whole week. The waitress took our order and I ordered an appetizer and a meal and asked if she could bring my grandson&#39;s food out when it was ready. She proceeded to bring his food out and appetizer which I did not eat very much of because I was looking forward to my meal. I did not see her again until an hour + later and by then I was really upset and did not want my meal, I was just ready to leave. Sitting and entertaining a 2 year old for an hour + is hard.  When I looked at my clock, I realized i had been there for one hour and 20 minutes and never got my meal and suddenly the waitress showed up and stated &#34;oh you never got your meal?&#34; Ummmm I only had one waitress so if you didn&#39;t bring it to me how would I have gotten it. Miraculously it was almost instantaneously prepared by which point I just wanted to leave. Due to this situation we only got to visit the aquarium for 30 minutes and that was very very frustrating. I am so disappointed in this experience and even after talking to the manager I didn&#39;t feel this situation was resolved. I assume that she saw a single person with a baby and figured I wouldn&#39;t be a good tipper so I wasn&#39;t worth her time. I however am an amazing tipper usually tipping between 25-30% so her loss for making assumptions. I of course will go back because i love this restaurant but not with my grandson and myself as it wasn&#39;t worth the money or time!

My wife and I stopped in for dessert after finishing dinner at another restaurant.  Strawberry cheesecake hit the spot for me.  My wife had the Smores Cheesecake.  She was given a large portion and was not able to finish it all.  We have eaten dinner here in the past and have always had a great meal and great service.  Our waiter tonight was prompt and friendly.  We will head back soon for a date night soon.  Good job everyone.

The Cheesecake Factory usually had great food and great service. Today we had neither. The crab bites tasted good but were cold. The spinach and cheese dip was horrible. Too much spinach and not enough cheese. So so bland. The chips were stale. When we sent it back, they didn&#39;t even ask why. Drinks ran and out and getting refills was difficult.  2 stars are because the cheesecake still tastes ok.

Not my particular style. Went during the holiday season, and why I don&#39;t know.  I don&#39;t care for the mall or the surrounding areas so I think I set myself up for failure with this visit.<br><br>Service was decent, but nothing special.<br>Food was likewise average, but nothing really stood out.  You would think with a menu as large as they have there would have been something that amazed me.  <br><br>I know i should give it a second chance, but I just don&#39;t think I can bring myself to it.

So I have been here twice this week and both experiences were substandard (which is pretty sad considering the price point is mid-high. <br><br>One of the times, I went in and just wanted a light lunch, so I sat at the bar. The bartender watched me come in and sit down but was talking with someone who was apparently a friend. I waited for ten minutes as she passed by me not really doing anything but chatting. Finally I tried getting her attention by saying &#34;excuse me&#34;, but it took me three times to get her to finally acknowledge me. Then I ordered a salad and a margarita. As I ordered, she rudely AND INCORRECTLY &#39;corrected&#39; my pronounciation of the name of the salad. When my food came, the salad was a little bland (it had very few of toppings described on the menu. The margarita glass had so much ice packed into it that there was hardly anything in there and the whole drink was watered down and covered in condensation.  She also used table salt for the rim. Srsly, you&#39;d think Cheesecake Factory could spring for something better.. <br><br>The bartender didn&#39;t even wait for me to ask for my bill. She just threw the bill on the counter in a cup. Yes, inside of an empty glass, I kid you not. When I paid cash,  she didn&#39;t pick it up and return my receipt . Essentially, I needed to leave and couldn&#39;t even get my change, despite asking for it; which forced me to overtip against my will. I&#39;m pretty sure that&#39;s stealing. <br><br>Then, when I was leaving, I went to the cheesecake counter and had a similarly crappy experience. I waited in line to order a piece to go. When I got to the counter, the lady acted impatient and rude. I ordered something out of the glass case and she rung up my order before informing me that I would have to wait for several minutes before they could open up a glass case, put a piece of cheesecake on there, and then hand it to me. Are you kidding me??!?? Instead, she chose to stand around and tidy up, chat with her co-workers and waste my time. Seriously?!?! What the heck?!?! I&#39;ve never regretted eating out more! I paid for an overpriced lunch and also got treated horribly! Just wow! What a disappointment.

Busiest day of the year. I understand that. But when I&#39;ve waited in line for 45 minutes to just get cheesecake and the guy at the register answers 3 phone calls before helping me - hmmmm. Not good customer service. Then he was rather rude about why he couldn&#39;t give me two pieces of cheesecake for the half price. Taking one home to a friend who is ill in bed. After waiting so long do they really think I&#39;m not gonna just get both pieces and pay whatever price they charge?  As I&#39;m leaving the line for just cheesecake is still out the door. Good thing the cake is so yummy.

Popped in for a little cheesecake treat and ended up splurging for dinner after Lisa, our waitress told us about some of the delicious dishes here. We were not disappointed! Her service was fabulous, prompt and friendly, and the food was as good as she said it&#39;d be! Overall a great experience and I will definitely be asking to be served by Lisa again!

Went there with my wife on Saturday and had the Miso Salmon.  It was maybe the best Salmon I&#39;ve eaten at a restaurant and my wife concurs.  Also, the waitress, &#34;Lisa&#34;, was as good as it gets.  She is friendly, listens, and actually understands customer service.  She has recommended the Chicken Stuffed Tortillas, so we&#39;ll go back soon and give them a try.  If she says they are good, I believe it.

Always great food and dessert is never a disappointment! They have great pizza and Chicken Marsala, the Fish and Chips are also great! I love the Lemon Raspberry, Black Tie Chocolate Cake cheesecake, but the Tiramisu and Lemon Meringue are also delicious! Service is also excellent, always attentive and helpful! I would give 5 stars but the acoustics are terrible and between the noise and music unless you go in on off hours it&#39;s impossible to carry on a conversation with your dining companions without shouting. If they turned down the music it would be perfect!

This Cheesecake Factory is pretty much the same as all the rest... Beautiful building, good food. Last time I went I didn&#39;t love the server but that happens right? One thing I hate about it is the dark lighting at night, I&#39;d like to be able to see my food a little more. All in all it wasn&#39;t my favorite experience (alright service and bad lighting) but I&#39;ll be back because the food is so good.
The food was decent, portions were good, the service was slow. The best dish at our table was the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. Expect to spend a lot $$$

I loved my dining experience at The Cheesecake Factory. My husband and I are from out of state and we don&#39;t have these restaurants close to us, but you can be sure I will be eating in the Cheesecake Factory when I&#39;m close.  <br><br>Our waiter, Tyler was very pleasant and he seemed to have perfect timing when it came to serving us.<br><br>The hamburger I had, was scrumptious.  It is so hard to find meats with flavor like when I was young. You could tell it didn&#39;t have preservatives because of the taste. The food was also presented so nicely on the plate.<br><br>I felt the place was so pretty, too. I&#39;m sure you can tell I was happy with my whole dining experience.  What a treat.<br><br>I took some cheesecake to go and I&#39;m looking forward to having it later.<br><br>I must say, everyone on the staff was cordial as my husband and I left also. They said thank you and wished us a nice rest of our evening !  Kudo&#39;s to all !

Is it a big chainish type place?  Yes.  Would I rather have been dining at an independently owned restaurant featuring an intimate setting and personal service?  Absolutely.  That being said, went to dinner here with a group of six, and found it to be better than I had anticipated.  <br><br>What I liked:   Firstly, they rock a fine cocktail (If I were rating the cocktails, absolutely four stars--I would definitely stop off here for an after mall shop cocktail sometime).  Not only that, but, my dining companion and I upgraded the vodka in our cocktails from the house to Belvedere and from what I could ascertain were charged very minimally for the more expensive vodka (don&#39;t know if it was an accident?  We each had a few, so the accident was made repeatedly, in that case).  Dinner was decent.  Wasn&#39;t wowed, but wasn&#39;t disappointed either.  I had the Portobello sandwich, which was well made with fresh mushrooms.  The fries were fine (not memorable...but fine).  The cheesecake was delicious.  They have a slew of varieties and offer an ample slice (we had some left over to take home). <br> <br>What I didn&#39;t like:<br>First, our group of six were seated at an overly large round table--seriously, it was so big we could hardly converse.<br><br>Secondly, our entire section reeked of fish.  So much so, that immediately we unanimously decided NOT to order any fish (ummm...ya smell fish?  It&#39;s not fresh).  <br><br>Finally, no fry sauce--this is Boise!  Ya gotta have the sauce!<br><br>Overall:<br>Go for the cocktails, stay for the cheesecake.  Or, like someone else mentioned, their menu is huge so if you&#39;re going in a group with varied tastes, definitely a solid choice.

They have good gluten free pasta and an astounding selection of food. As with all Cheesecake Factories, I guess if the &#34;GF by request &#34; icon was just a little larger, it would be easier to sort through it all. But I am very grateful that they offer the great selection of gluten free meals that they do. The food was good, but this place has super uncomfortable booth benches. I have not encountered that in other Cheesecake Factory locations. <br><br>My first order came with my pasta undercooked. They gave me a salad so I&#39;d have something to eat while my replacement meal cooked. When it came it was just fine. The manager made a point of checking on me after I ate to make sure all had worked out. <br><br>I think the uncomfortable seats and noise level were drawbacks, but the pasta was pretty yummy - and huge portions as well. My remaining gluten free pasta heated up quite nicely for lunch the next day!

I&#39;m writing this review in regards to the terrible service I received at this Cheesecake Factory location. when our waiter Robert approached us he seemed very solemn and mediocre. he wasn&#39;t excited to be working at the Cheesecake Factory as the waiters usually are. it was very disappointing since I don&#39;t live close to a Cheesecake Factory and I always look forward to getting to dine here when I travel to bigger cities. he didn&#39;t make our experience good he made it mediocre. it just made us feel really blah after we left the restaurant. the food was great as usual but the service we received was not the usual. disappointed.
Just about what you expect from Cheese Cake Factory, the worse part of this place is the novel I mean the menu you have to read to order

This has to be the worst dining experience ever at a local Cheesecake. 15 mins wait for a table when many are available but not bussed. Very dirty water glass that was never replaced and a very long 48 mins wait for a pasta and chicken lettuce wrap dish. Unexplainable really, especially when the restaurant is more than half empty at 7:30 on a Thursday night. The manager could have done more than comp my pasta  and my toddler&#39;s mac n cheese knowing that I was tweeting my experience and had mentioned that I wanted to speak with them first, but he didn&#39;t seem to care. Perhaps that&#39;s all they can do because they&#39;re swamped with other complaints at that particular location and previous reviews on Yelp. Since it&#39;s a chain, it all boiled down to service as one should expect consistency in their food, no complaints there.
We went for lunch and our service was amazing.  The fish and chips were fresh and tasty.  The cheese cake was delicious as well.  Pretty spendy, but worth ever bite.

Came here for my wife&#39;s birthday. I&#39;ve been to other locations and had a good experience but not really here. The place was pretty empty, yet our server was hardly present and our food took a really long time to cook. Once it was here it was pretty good but not worth what we paid.  Sad to say but we probably won&#39;t be back to this location.

This is my second time eating at this location.  The food is always good. The complimentary bread was hot and fresh and tasty. Both the chicken dishes we had were tasty and hot. As most people know, the serving sizes at Cheesecake Factory are really large so we had plenty to take home. The mashed potatoes were very good and my mango-lime cheesecake was tops. <br>Staff was nice, frequent check-backs. The wait was a little long, about an hour. But it was Friday night at about 7:30 or 8 pm and should be expected. <br>The only complaints would be that there was limited in-door seating in the foyer and we had to wait outside on benches in March for our table. Also the interior is pretty noisy.

So yea was pretty crazy tonight but my friend and I wandered into the bar area to try to find an open table there and this kind waiter told us one was coming open! Score. 3min wait ;) then Isaiah? (I hope that was his name... I&#39;m seriously really bad with names...) bartender. Looks 19, haha  ;) he took really good care of us. Funny, attentive, fast, personable. Really made us feel at ease. Didnt feel rushed at all despite how busy it was. It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve had service that good. Haven&#39;t been to the cheesecake factory in along time but I&#39;ll Def be going back! Oh and the lemon meringue cheesecake!  Oh my word heaven!!!

Simply put, The food was not good. I ordered the &#34;specialty salmon&#34; and it was over-salted and ultra fishy. Their only saving grace is the cheesecake. I will never go here for a meal again but I will surely return for another piece of cheesecake.

Very dirty. Not sure if this is because of the sprinkler issues just this week or what. My family and I were seated in the second booth as you walk in their door to the left. Our table had NOT been wiped down. There was actually catsup smears and crumbs all over it - I was disgusted. The window and vent were covered in dust and crumbs....<br><br>After having a great first visit to the WA Square Cheesecake Factory in OR we thought we&#39;d give it a try here. Not impressed. To boot our bill was even more $$$ than OR AND we ordered the same thing..... Not sure why ID would be more expensive than OR.....We were there on 11/22/14.<br><br>We will not be back... a bit grossed out.

The food is standard chain restaurant food. I&#39;ve been many times and will probably go again if it&#39;s the most convenient option. However I suggest asking not to be sat in Robert&#39;s section (a tall blonde gentleman). Not only was his service poor but his attitude was abhorrent. He actually got aggressive and confrontational with my husband when his tip reflected his bad service.

I love coming here!  the service is great and the food was fabulous.  The decor is neat and the bar was very well maintained and open for people to see the bartenders at work.  Bring whoever you want here for good times and good eats.

Today&#39;s visit was a real disappointment. The food took at least 45 minutes to arrive. They claim to have timed it at 1hr 4 min start to finish. I believe that may have been the time that the waitress entered our order, but she didn&#39;t get it into the system very fast. The burger served to me was completely charred on one side, in 3 pieces hidden under melted cheese. I believe they didn&#39;t want to have to start the order over when they knew it was messed up, so they tried to hide it, but even if that wasn&#39;t the case, the burger was really nasty tasting. The other 3 orders at the table were &#34;delicious&#34;, and our server was very friendly and helpful. I still won&#39;t be going back any time soon because I just don&#39;t have 2 hours to sit around held captive in their restaurant.

You can always count on the cheesecake factory to deliver a consistently good meal and good service. Even though I almost always order the same item, it&#39;s always delicious.  Regardless of what you order, your meal always starts with their delicious, fresh baked sourdough and black bread; served warm with creamy butter.  My favorite menu item is their Asian chicken lettuce wrap tacos.  The wraps are served in leaves of tender Bibb lettuce, filled with grilled, moist chicken, fresh bean sprouts, shredded carrots, and other Asian components.  My favorite part is the two sauces you drizzle over the top, one a sweet cilantro sauce, the other a sweet soy sauce based sauce.  The sauces are addicting.  Nicely flavored and a perfect addition to the taco toppings. It&#39;s ordered off the light meals section and with the bread is just the right amount of food without feeling too guilty.  Today I splurged and tried their buffalo chicken nuggets.  The nuggets are made in house with a nice crispy batter coating, juicy chicken inside, and a schmear of buffalo hot sauce on top.  Some come skewered on a toothpick with a dill pickle slices, which adds a nice briny contrast, and ranch dressing is served on the side for dipping.  Not only are they delicious, but also a very good value at only $5 for 6 large nuggets, good for sharing as a starter.  Our server was good and offered not only the daily specials but recommendations.  Our food came out quickly, and our drinks were re-filled a couple times, would have appreciated a refill after we finished eating and were still talking, but still good service otherwise.

Had some friends in town last night and we met them, like we always do, at this place. I usually avoid big chains but I have come to really appreciate the Cheesecake Factory. They have an extensive menu, the food is prepared well, is tasty, served promptly, and is hot. The service is excellent -- they must train their staff extremely well. And the prices are totally reasonable. If anything the weakest part of the meal was the Cheesecake itself. But, as a chain they continue to impress me -- well at least this one place does, I have not been to others. I totally recommend this Cheesecake Factory! [BTW -- as was recently in the press, and the subject of lawsuits, we also experienced the inflated tip suggestions on our bill. We split the bill 50/50 across two credit cards but the suggested tips on the bill were based on the whole amount. Luckily we noticed it at the time and didn&#39;t make the mistake of overtipping. SHAME ON CHEESECAKE FACTOR FOR THIS DECEPTIVE PRACTICE. THERE IS NO POSSIBLE EXCUSE FOR IT.]

Don&#39;t order the salad and sandwich cuz, hello did you order a sandwich with that lettuce. Foods over priced and I just witnessed one of the table staff lay clean napkins on the floor then on a clean table for set up, that&#39;s nasty. The decor does not scream cheesecake to me,it screams don&#39;t set me under one of those light fixtures, they are scary. I guess next time I will stick to the food court.

Okay, I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory restaurants. The menu is immense and everything I&#39;ve tried on it is delicious. The atmosphere is great too. Feels very upper class almost. <br>The servers are very knowledgeable and easy to joke around with.<br>My only complaint is that my waitress got my order wrong. They brought me the complete wrong thing. I don&#39;t know what she heard me say...<br>I corrected them and they were happy to bring me what I ordered. Its just annoying to watch everyone else you&#39;re with start to eat while you&#39;re waiting. It&#39;s not going to deter me from returning or anything though.

The service was top notch and the food was really great.  Had an issue with a drink ordered, but the waiter and manager handled it professionally.  Wait time was a little long, but guess it is to be expected on a Friday night.

All CF are the same. As I recall, the BTS one has giggly girl servers who should learn how to wait tables and givevattention to diners.  I am selective about where I spend my dining out dollars. CF is average.

WHY WAS THERE NO CELL SERVICE IN THIS RESTAURANT! Otherwise, food was delicious. I got the chicken salad sandwich and a baked potato soup. Yummy! I also tried the jambalaya, which was so freaking good, better than I&#39;ve ever tasted. A little on the spicy side, but I love spicy! Waitress was super nice and helpful in making my  lunch selection.<br><br>I got a coffee cheesecake. YUM! Really good, never liked this restaurant so much until now.

Food is good. Cheese cake is amazing! Service is terrible. We are from California originally and have been to several of the franchise locations there and were always pleased with our meal. The Boise location needs some major help with its service. The good is to the same quality but we have been here five times now and keep giving it another shot in hopes it will get better. Out of the five visits we only got a good server once and the other four were the worst we have had anywhere! One insulted us, another broke glass on our food and didn&#39;t offer to replace it, and the other two disappeared for over forty five minutes. So depressing because I love the cheese cake!!!!!
Fried grn beans and the seasoned edamame with an iced grn tea! Of course the bread basket and butter brought me in!

Really nice looking place when you enter and you know they put in a lot of architecture work into it and it shows. I like to keep it simple and end up getting the strawberry cheesecake and it was really good. A lot better than what you get from a convenience store and it is expected from this place. They have a lot of different options when it comes to foods and desserts and from what I&#39;ve seen they put in a lot of work to make everything look appealing to their customers. Perfect place to eat for really any occasion and I highly recommend it.
Waited 45 minutes for food.  Kitchen staff was incompetent.   Very poorly run and not deserving of the name.  Expect better from this chain.

Cheesecake Factory always has something to fill your hungry tummy. We sat at the bar and has some appetizers. The service was so amazing. Our server was so nice and even offered me a warm wet towel to clean my &#34;sticky fingers&#34; from my appetizers. I was impressed!!  Potatoes bravas=YUMMMMMMMM!!

We stopped by on Saturday evening for a small celebration.  Fortunately, a couple of us went there early to get a table.  Over an hour wait, wow ok our plan worked out but we really didn&#39;t want to cruise the mall for an hour until the rest of the party arrived.  As it turned out timing was perfect.  <br><br>Had the Jamaica Black Pepper Shrimp, potato soup and the 30th anniversary cake.  Fabulous food, exceptional service always attentive and took care of our needs without being intrusive.  Staff also sang a great Happy Birthday.  Only minor thing was I should have either ordered cake or cheese cake.  Didn&#39;t go for the confused desert.

My daughter and I went to the Cheesecake Factory this past weekend.  We were seated at a table about 3&#34; from a family who was super loud.  I could hardly talk to my daughter right across the table from me.  Right after we sat down I looked around and saw several booths available.  I asked to be moved to a booth so we could visit with each other ... We were REFUSED. I should have walked out, I wanted but my daughter wanted to stay. It wasn&#39;t because we were a table of two as I watched them seat each of those booths with couples.  Forget the Cheesecake Factory ... There are a lot of other places to eat who care about customer service.

My husband ordered the lemon and herb roasted chicken and it was AMAZING!  The sauce was very tangy:). I ordered sheppards pie, which I had never had before, it was very good:)<br>Make sure you give yourself plenty of time to order as the menu is GIGANTIC!<br><br>Lastly, but not least, make sure you don&#39;t leave without some cheesecake, it&#39;s amazing!

had a salad, turkey sandwich, and dessert, they brought me the wrong sandwich but I got it later and the manager comped the my entree.  That was nice of her to do and I thanked her also. The manago key lime pie is the bomb and was the the only memorable thing about the meal.  Nice decor and a nice bar also.

Received  excellent  service from Cerdaro and Chloe. They were. Both on point. Not only fast, efficient and friendly but had us cracking up laughing.the GM Don made himself readily available, which from my experience is rare. Bravo to Boise cheesecake  factory , I&#39;ve been all over the country and Boise&#39;s  is the best one. And food so good &#34;you&#39;ll slap yo mamma.&#34;.lol

Service was great!  Food was delicious!  My only wish is that they would have a sampler plate of cheesecake available for dessert instead of having to buy one huge piece.  Five or six small pieces of a variety would be ideal!

OK, I want to hate Cheesecake Factory.  Chain, giant menu, with ads, in the mall, etc...  I can speak to their brunch that it is quite good.  Their patio is nice and reasonably insulated from the mall parking lot.  I have never had great service, but the service is, well, serviceable.  My last visit a table went unubused next to us for our entire meal, which is bad.  There are better local brunch options in Boise (Goldy&#39;s, The Griddle), but not that you can walk in to any time, get a table and full bar options and have a good meal.  Try the chilaquiles (get extra salsa verde and a lime) and you can split them between any two people with a reasonable appetite.

My coworkers and I came here for our company Christmas party and the service was great and of course the food was amazing. Gotta get my go-to avocado egg rolls and the baja tacos. Then of course the cheesecake came and I had to take it to go but nonetheless yummy the day after. We played a game out our table and even though we were kinda loud and obnoxious, the employees were having a good time watching us get through it. This is our second year and we love it.

Excellent service! Our waitress was honest about her likes and dislikes in a respectable way. Tried the Crispy Chicken Costoletta. DELICIOUS!!! Very big portions. Not greasy, not too heavy. Also had the Red Velvet Cheesecake. Another great recommendation. I debated between that &amp; Key lime or Vanilla Bean. I will definitely go back!

Disgusting.<br>I guess I should add more, but I think that sums it up.  I know, what should I expect, the place is called &#34;the cheesecake factory&#34;, but I went there because I had a gift card.  <br>My wife and I both ordered the &#39;pizza and a salad&#39; lunch.  The salad was okay, about what you would expect for a chain, but the pizza was covered with imitation cheese that tasted like plastic, gross mushrooms from a can, etc.  <br>We should have expected this, as the menu is fifty pages long, and whenever there are that many items on a menu it should be obvious that the place uses non-fresh everything and is marginal at cooking everything.<br>Please Boise, veto this place, it is not what we want coming into town.

Yes this is just another link of the chain restaurant, the food here is GREAT. The Salmon is one of my favorite dishes - I&#39;m not a big fan of ordering fish that I haven&#39;t cooked myself, but it&#39;s very well cooked (I usually order the barbeque salmon). The only thing that keeps this from being a perfect 5 stars is the price of the wine. Really, you can easily spend about $30 a bottle, so keep your eye out on that. Also, they can&#39;t seem to keep managers for some reason (although it doesn&#39;t really seem to affect the overall feeling of the place). The weekend nights usually bring you over an hour wait, so call ahead and make reservations. Overall, the restaurant is an excellent experience with good food and cool ambience.
Had a great lunch today. Lindsey was a fantastic server and the food was excellent.  Make a special trip to go to this restaurant.

It&#39;s not about the cheesecakes, it&#39;s about the sweet corn tamale cakes on the appetizer menu.  OH YEAH.  Fairly good cocktails, be aware entrees will be huge, so &#39;lunch portions&#39; is a good plan. You&#39;ll have a box at the end in any case, really. <br><br>Seating slow at peak times, which is Sunday Brunch here in Boise. They apparently don&#39;t do reservations after 12pm on Sundays, so if you need a large group seated, have a member go and get on the list. We needed seating for 14 (three were kids) over the holidays, and expected something of a nightmare, but were attracted by the menu&#39;s variety as we knew some members of our party were picky (in various ways, such as being diabetic).  We were actually seated reasonably quickly because we called ahead to warn, sent a representative to wait, and all showed up fairly quickly when they called us. Service good, menu large/extensive, yes it&#39;s a chain, and it&#39;s ridiculously popular here in Boise judging by busyness.

The Cheesecake Factory is so overrated to me.  It was nice that they brought it to Boise though.  The menu is extensive but I&#39;ve never tried any dish that made me fall in love.  I will say that the apple martinis are really good and plus you have the awesome cheesecakes.<br><br>However, if you&#39;re going out with a group and no one can decide what type of restaurant to go to Cheesecake Factory would be good.  Everybody can surely find something they&#39;d want to order.<br><br>For the most part, just go there for dessert and drinks.  Skip the food.

We&#39;ve been fans of The Cheesecake Factory for several years, originally in Portland, OR area.  This Boise location provided the same menu with good service.  But...we just had lunch there, treating guests, and were very disappointed.  The service was slow, although the server was very nice, and the food was so-so.  The menu has changed, apparently, as some of our favorite items don&#39;t taste like they used to.  [corporate cut-backs?]  Not sure we&#39;ll return to The Cheesecake Factory since the prices are still high but the food quality just doesn&#39;t cut it.  Some complaints: silverware was smeared and spotted, looking not quite clean; one guest&#39;s chopped salad contained browned, tired lettuce, etc.; another guest&#39;s pasta dish tasted as if a lot of sugar had been added (crusted chicken Romano and pasta); and the flies were thick inside the restaurant...I was constantly batting flies away from my food (=ugh!).  The bill was $74 for four of us for a very mediocre and rather unpleasant meal!<br><br>Got a nice response from a Cheesecake Factory representative (8/12/16) so we tried it again (9/3/16).  Had great service but the food still is not like it used to be.  This time Chicken Bellagio was ordered, a favorite for the past few years, and the chicken&#39;s breading was VERY spicy (hot), which it never was previously.  Two members of our party ordered a pasta dish (pasta with shrimp and sausage) and said it was over-the-hill spicy hot...and one of these people loves jalapeno-loaded foods!  Needless to say, the pasta was not enjoyed or eaten down!  I asked the server if they had had menu changes and he was adamant that they hadn&#39;t (said it might be a cook who was doing some changes...?); but I think he was a fairly new employee at this restaurant.  Even the cheesecake we ordered (four different types) was rather blah, compared to the flavorful selections of the past!  What in the world is going on at The Cheesecake Factory?  Guess we&#39;ll be avoiding this restaurant from now on!  <br><br>The two stars&#39; rating still stands!!

Great food and excellent service,my wife and I love a good burger and we did not expect them to be the best burgers in Boise,but hands down their quality meat and perfectly cooked burgers were amazing,makes other local burgers taste like fast food in comparison,highly recommend this place....

We&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factories all over the country and love the good.  Portions are quite large so bring your appetite or be prepared to take some home.  I will have to say this particular location in Boise is the friendliest of all I have been too. Our server was was great, friendly and accessible but not overbearing.

Sat down and our table was sticky and had food all over it and there were CHUNKS of food all over the bench from the previous diners still. Literally we wiped off the bench in front of the hostess who was seating us...clearly she had to of seen all the food on the seats but did nothing. Just watched us wipe it off. Disgusting. Then had to ask them to come wipe our table down again. Waiter forgot to bring my daughters juice until we had to ask 20 min after we all got our drinks and she never got the water we asked for. I also asked for another water since I gave her mine and that took about 25 min to get. Food took forever to get and was nothing spectacular. Ordered my daughter a grilled cheese which was cold when it arrived to the table. Pretty disappointing dining experience. Wish we had gone elsewhere...

Love &#39;em or hate &#39;em, its everything a Cheescake Factory should be. If you have never been to one, trust me Idaho, you&#39;re gonna love it!!<br>Near the mall. Since its Idaho, there&#39;s free parking everywhere!!!!

Huge menu. Nice staff good food. No cel service in there restaurant so go here to get a break from your cel and you can really claim there calls never reached you. Nice to untether for an hour. Restaurant is at the mall so you can shop and then refuel. Oh and cheesecake. Oh my
Had some steak, potatoes, vegetables and it was amazing. Our waitress was AMAZING! She was very friendly, and helpful with the menu. It was delicious

We&#39;ve been there several times since this location opened. We went last night at about 5 p.m. It wasn&#39;t busy at all and we ordered quickly, but ordered items that weren&#39;t our normal choices. My husband order fish tacos and I ordered the Shrimp Louie. It was strange when the meal came and my husband was given the fish and chips and I got a salad with 6 medium size shrimp down the center. Obviously my husband&#39;s order was just plain wrong, but mine was extremely disappointing. I&#39;ve never had a Shrimp Louie with a few shrimp on top - generally it is a large portion of small, sweet bay shrimp, something for every bite of your salad. To say I was disappointed would be a major disappointment. When we finally caught the waitress to say that not only had my husband order fish tacos, but the fish and chips arrived with only catsup, no tartar sauce, she looked at us like we didn&#39;t know what he ordered. I know that is what he requested because it&#39;s not an item he usually chooses and I was a little surprised to hear it. But rather than apologize for a mistake, she acted like we had hurt her feelings even though he told her that he would eat the fish and chips. He could have requested that she correct the situation, but he chose to let it slide. We actually felt like had this been our first visit, we would have felt that we wasted $40+ for a really lousy meal. We&#39;ve been there plenty of times before, but this could slow our rate of return visits really substantially.

First of all the staff was amazing. Yesterday I was here at the cheesecake factory. I ordered the build your own omelet with their amazing potato. Sadly the potatos were over cooked and hard as a rock. The waitress noticed I did not eat them after I had said how much I really liked them when I placed my order. She asked what was wrong? I had to tell her they were overcooked and hard as a rock and I could not even get my fork to go through them. She offered to bring more but at this time I was full and did not want a load of potatoes brought to me I was finished with my meal. She tried to provide something else soup or salad but as I mentioned I was full. She said well I will talk to the manager we need to do something about this. Totally her idea. Before I knew it the manager arrived and she even said I saw those they were hard as a rock that&#39;s not how they should be. She had took it upon herself to comp my breakfast for me which I did not expect. I have to say that this aggressive move to make sure I was a happy customer really got my attention. I will certainly be back this was not the norm and their food is amazing and so is the staff.
What a joke.  Sat for 20 minutes with no server even talking to us.  Manager offered a gift card for a return visit.  Why would we go back when we did not get to eat today.

Our servers name was Michael. He was very polite, energetic, friendly with the guests. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and attentive to the younger generation. The atmosphere was relaxing &amp; casual. The food tasted great, was perfect temperature and portions were great for the price. Cheesecake is amazing as well.
Very good place to eat or to bring a date,  food will for sure fill you up. Recommend
I&#39;m a fan of the bar..been searching for the ultimate lemon drop, they make one that&#39;s a double with a little extra sugar that pretty good and the cheesecake isn&#39;t bad either...
The food was good, not great.  But in my opinion, the restaurant as a whole is way over priced in comparison to getting great food for less at one of the other many options that Boise has to offer.

Lunch for 4 on 9/2...  There was a salad (chicken/avocado); spicy chicken on brown rice; something like Tuscan chicken from the skinny menu (which is almost un-American at the cheesecake factory) and huevos rancheros.<br>As typical, service was good; the server (big dude with a thick beard) did a nice job.  Also as par norm, it takes a bit longer than you&#39;d like to get your meal and the floor manager did come around and say...sorry about the wait, your food will be up shortly. <br>The food was typical CCF food, huge portions of well flavored food.  The salad actually looked killer and I would order that next time.  The spicy chicken wasn&#39;t the best, it was the same general&#39;s chicken recipe you get at any local Chinese restaurant...so nothing to knock your socks off there.  The skinny thing looked o.k. and the person eating it liked it and the huevos rancheros looked really good and the person eating it said it was.<br>Good food, nice atmosphere, good service...I would say go there...
My first review was three stars and I find myself going back on regular occasions therefore I am revising my review to four stars.   They now have a skinny menu that is fantastic!

Had lunch while travelling, the place was empty for its size, but it took 15 minutes to get a seat, then the service was slow.  The food portions are large, the food is prepared correctly.  The staff needs an education on people skills and the waitress&#39;s and waiters need to tend to the clientele not themselves.

I always have great service and food here. I know its a little $$$ but you do get a lot of food for the money. I have tried lots of things here and will not grip over any of the food. This is a must go to place.

Had lunch here with my wife and the food was really good. The server was nice and attentive a little cheesy because it seemed she had all of her lines from a script. But still she was good.The avocado egg rolls Really good. The thai lettice wraps very good as well.Upside down pineapple cheese cake oooh soo good.We will be back!
I feel like I shouldn&#39;t like this restaurant so much because it&#39;s a corporate chain, but I do!  Consistent food and services.  This is a well trained staff.

Great place to go with a large group... Wrong!  They will NOT take reservations for large parties! You cannot even call ahead. I asked for a party of 7 tonight at 7. The manager said no. Then they suggested I call to see how busy they are tonight before I come. No, the call will not help with getting a table - it will just let us know how long we will likely wait. They will only help us when the whole party is there. What the heck!  We will go somewhere else at 7 - with a reservation!

Thanks to a gift card we made it to The Cheesecake Factory in Boise. Our Sunday dinner was pleasantly good. We tried the sweet corn tamale cakes, and they were tasty, a bit mushier than I expected. We had a variety of dishes. From pasta to pizza to sandwiches nobody seemed to be disappointed with a choice. The service was outstanding. The waiter, Will or Bill, made the experience a blast.

The appetizer was great!!  The avocado spring rolls!  My entree was pretty decent..mahi mahi with a mango chutney all sitting on a huge helping of mashed potatoes.  The decor was almost like a casino!  The staff was decent.  I can&#39;t get that appetizer dish out of my mind though.  Also, a bit pricey.  Too full afterwards...no room for the cheesecake!!  I&#39;d go back for the Avocado spring rolls

If you are a fan of warehouse-style dining (big open space, loud, busy atmosphere, same food at each location), it&#39;s hard to beat CCF. It had been ages since I wandered into one of this chain&#39;s restaurants, longer still for the food and not the tasty martinis.<br>Say what you will about the food. Yes it&#39;s chain food, and yes it&#39;s probably not the healthiest choice out there. That said, we were pleasantly surprised when our food arrived and it tasted - and appeared - like it had been prepared by someone that actually cared about what they were serving. I&#39;ve been to CCFs in more metropolitan areas, and ones in more chi-chi areas - but Boise&#39;s has them beat in food prep and taste.<br><br>But what really made the Mrs. and I enjoy our meal was our server - Amy K. It was obvious that she enjoys the fact that her job brings a new set of people to her every hour, and it was very apparent that she sees it as an opportunity to make a new set of friends for that time. She was very helpful, happy to be there, and as our meal went on, very personable and conversational. Not your typical &#34;How you doing, ready to order, how&#39;s the food, thanks for coming&#34; that you&#39;d expect from a place like this. I honestly feel like she really cared about us and our meal, and if we walked in there tomorrow (two months after our actual visit), she&#39;d remember us.  If I owned the place, I&#39;d either put her up front greeting people, or put her in charge of making sure everyone on the floor has the right attitude. Her service quite honestly made the experience better, and is the reason for my writing this review.

As far as chains go, this is a good one. This was one of the only places open on Christmas eve. We had some wine and an appetizer. Which were good but what we really wanted was the cheesecake. I had a Key Lime Cheesecake and he had a Red Velvet Cheesecake.  We also got two more slices to go.

Service was really good.  I had the Renee;&#39;s Special.  I didn&#39;t really care for it.  It was mostly salad and soup.  I don&#39;t like the Cheesecake Factory salad anyway because of the bittter greens in it.  The soup was barley...just not my favorite.  The Chicken Salad sandwich was O.K.  I am still giving 4 stars because I know I would have been happy with my regular...the Mushroom Burger.  By the way, drinks are a whopping $2.95.  However, they didn&#39;t mind when I asked for a to go cup.
Always good never disappointing! Love so many dishes here. A simple favorite is the four cheese pasta.

Read J.K.&#39;s review and we are staying right near the CCF so we thought we&#39;d give it a try. Our first time at a CCF so we really didn&#39;t know what to expect. My wife had the Shepherd&#39;s Pie and I ordered the Chicken Bellagio. Both dinners were served in a very timely manner and were perfectly prepared. The food was hot and attractive in appearance. The meals were both delicious. And, there is a LOT of food.<br><br>Now for the real treat. Again, following J.K.&#39;s advice, we asked if Amy was working when we came in. She was and we asked to be seated in her station. We were escorted to a table for two. Amy appeared promptly and is everything J.K. described. We told her about her celebrity status on Yelp and she was quite surprised. After we were seated, it became obvious that there was a party of 10 to be seated right next to us. Amy suddenly appeared and asked if we would like to move to a booth instead. Given my hearing difficulties, that was an offer too good to refuse. She immediately bussed the just vacated booth and moved us over. Everything about Amy is just as J.K. stated. She is a first rate server and a real credit to CCF. I don&#39;t know about any other CCF servers since this was our first visit, but I would love to encounter Amy at every restaurant we visit. Thanks, Amy. And if anyone from CCF is visiting this site, find Amy and clone her. She is truly a treasure.
